Adelina is requesting this loan to buy additional items to sell in her store, including animals such as chickens. She started this business last year with $200 of her own capital. She lives in her simple house where the roof is made of zinc and the walls of palm branches. Her goal for the future is to expand the size of her store.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell from her store, including animals such as chickens.

loans.name: Wangninagbe 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAGBE 5 est composé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à une même association d’artisans. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Danton Pierre est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Danton Pierre n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Danton Pierre est âgé de 39 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Pierrette. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants à charge. Danton Pierre vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Danton Pierre exerce la couture depuis près de dix huit ans dans son atelier. Afin de renforcer ses matériels de travail dans le but de faire face à sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Danton Pierre sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAGBE 5. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à rehausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group called WANGNINAGBE 5 is made up of three persons who are part of the same association of artisans. It's the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé, in order to expand the level of their activities. The representative of the group, Danton Pierre, is the one raising his hand in the photo. 

Danton Pierre did not attend school. He is 39 and married to a merchant named Pierrette. The couple have four children, all enrolled in school and in their parents' care. Besides their biological children, the couple have three other children in their care. 

Danton Pierre lives together with his wife and children. The various household expenses are catered for by the couple. To manage his share, Danton Pierre has been working n his sewing workshop for almost 18 years. Wishing to add to his work equipment so that he can keep up with his ever-growing clientele, Danton Pierre is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group called WANGNINAGBE 5. This loan will surely allow them to raise the level of their businesses and make more profit. Their first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy a machine.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 38 years old and married, with two children, both in school.  Her husband is a police officer. 

Herminia has a kiosk.   She is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase additional supplies for her store, including flour, oil, soap, and rice. She opened her kiosk one year ago with a working capital of US $300.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, soap, rice, and other items for her kiosk.

loans.name: Emalin

texts.en: Emalin is 40 years old and lives in San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur with her husband and four children. She earns a living by planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns PHP 8,500 a month. She joined GDMPC in 2007, and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her farm to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita tiene 30 años, tiene un hijo de 8 años, a quien cuida con mucho amor. Su casa es rústica y está ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Desde que tenía 17 años trabajaba en los cultivos de sus padres, desde entonces cultiva café y plátanos. Pero hace 4 años ya vive independientemente con su hijo, por ello produce en dos parcelas café y plátanos. Con las ventas puede asegurar a su hijo una educación y cubrir sus gastos prioritarios. Cuando el trabajo en el campo cesa, en los meses de noviembre se encarga de elaborar viveros de café, “invierto en abono, semilla y bolsas especiales, pero sale a cuenta cuando se vende”, menciona. Sarita vende cada bolsa con una plantita a 40 céntimos. Sus planes futuros son de renovar algunas plantas de café que quedaron débiles por la última cosecha, por eso invertirá en bolsas de abono y en el pago para la limpieza de sus cultivos.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por eso se compromete, una vez más, en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales”, donde es una socia activa y partícipe.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de cinco bolsas de fertilizantes (con 700 soles). Lo restante será para pagar la limpieza de su cafetal.
texts.en:
Sarita is 30 years old and has an eight year old son whom she cares for with a lot of love.  Her home is rustic and located in a native community in the central jungle.  

Since the age of 17 and up until four years ago she had been working in agriculture, mainly coffee and plantains, with her parents.  Since then she has been living independently with her son producing coffee and plantains on two parcels of land.  With her sales she is able to secure an education for her son and cover her primary expenses.  

When work in the field ceases, in November, she is responsible for developing coffee nurseries.  She mentions, "I invest in fertilizer, seeds, and special bags but I only see a return when they sell."  Sarita sells each bag with a seedling at 40 cents.  Her future plans are to regenerate some of the coffee plants that were weak the last harvest.  This is why she will invest in fertilizer and the harvesting of her crops.  

This will be her fourth credit with MFP.  This is why she once again promises to pay her monthly bills on time.  She belongs to the communal bank "Los Naranjales" where she is an active member and participant.  She will invest the money in the purchase of five bags of fertilizer (with 700 Sols).  The remainder will go towards the harvesting of her crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the harvesting of her coffee crops.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Agusta is 23 years old and married.  Her husband works for a local NGO called Belun (which means friends), and they have one child. 

Agusta has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including flour, oil, soap, and animals, like chickens, goats, and pigs.  She opened her kiosk one year ago with a working capital of 200. 

She hopes with the income, she can support their children and help them to get a good education.

loans.use: To buy needed items including flour, oil, soap, and animals.

loans.name: Karina Janeth

texts.es:
Karina tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de comida como: pollo, carne, arroz, pescado, ensalada, refresco, sodas y demás productos comestibles. También vende antojitos como: yuca frita y salcochada, panes con pollo, hamburguesas, etc. Estos productos los vende en una zona de mucho comercio en horarios de 11:00 a.m. a 4:30 p.m. antes de establecer el negocio ella se dedicaba a estudiar.

La materia prima tales como el pollo, arroz, carne, pescado, verdura para ensalada, etc. para la elaboración de sus comidas, las adquiere en un mercado que esta a tres kilómetros de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 10 libras de pollo, 10 libras de carne, 10 libras de pescado, verduras, 30 gallinas indias para elaborar los sabrosos panes de gallina india, 2 mesas y 8 sillas plásticas. Con la inversión aumentara el inventario, para disponer de más variedad de comida a la vista y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ya que la demanda es bastante grande, por lo que espera incrementar los ingresos; para solicitar a la Alcaldía Municipal de la ciudad un puesto de venta al interior del mercado de la municipalidad y así establecer bien su negocio, comprar mobiliario para que sus clientes puedan degustar su comida ahí mismo y no le pidan para llevar.
texts.en:
Karina is 21 years old and single. She sells food such as chicken, meat, rice, fish, salad, soft drinks, pop, and other edible products. She also sells snacks such as fried or boiled yucca, chicken sandwiches, hamburgers etc. She sells these items in a busy commercial area between 11 am and 4:30 pm. Before starting this business, she was a student.

Karina buys the ingredients for the meals (chicken, rice, fish, salad greens etc.) from a market which is three km from her house.

The loan she is seeking will be used to buy 10 lb of chicken, 10 lb of meat, 10 lb of fish, vegetables, 30 whole chickens to make her tasty chicken dishes, two tables and eight plastic chairs. This investment will provide her with more stock so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of food and satisfy their wishes. Demand for the food is high so Karina expects to earn more income. She will also use the loan money to ask for a stall in the interior of the market from the Municipality and put her business on a sound footing. As well she wishes to buy furniture so that her customers will enjoy eating the food on the premises instead of asking for take-out.

loans.use: buy the ingredients for the meals (chicken, rice, fish, salad greens etc.), 2 tables and 8 chairs

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Ailene is from Kapatagan, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Ailene is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Ailene makes and sells a variety of snack foods/items in the local community. Ailene has been in her business for two years and earns PHP 2,800 a month for these activities. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients she needs to make products for sale. 

In 2011, Ailene joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make her snack foods for sale.

loans.name: Made

texts.en: Made is 36 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali. She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 9. Her daughter is in the fourth grade and her son is in his second year of junior high school. Her husband is a farmer. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by raising piglets, and is now seeking a loan for 11,000 IDR from MUK to expand her business. She will use this loan to buy piglets, a sow and feed for them to eat, as well as build a barn for her animals. With her earnings, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy piglets, a sow and feed, and build a barn for her animals.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is 48 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines with her husband and three children. For the last six years, she has earned a living by selling snacks. She earns PHP 3,500 a month, and is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make products to sell. Celia joined GDMPC last year, and hopes to use the additional income she earns to expand her business and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Changement De Meyak 1 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Poligene habite dans la ville Meyak d’Haïti où de l’électricité n’existe pas et l’eau est très limitée.

Poligène a dirigé son commerce du Charbon pendant les dernières 11 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle était un professeur

Poligène voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir au commerce du charbon et de bois. Poligène utiliser le prêt pour investir et faire croître votre entreprise.

Les autres membres de Changement de Meyak ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses
texts.en:
Poligène lives in the town of Meyak, in Haiti, where there is no electricity and where the water supply is very limited.

She has been managing a charcoal business for the past 11 years.  Before starting this business, she was a teacher.

She would like to use this loan to invest in the business of charcoal and wood and to expand her activity.

The other members of the group "Changement de Meyak" need a loan to finance such activities such as selling charcoal, rice and used clothes.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and wood.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es: La señora Sayda de 30 años de edad conviviente con el señor Sabino más de 15 años, con 3 hijos dependientes que están estudiando, viven en área rural comunidad de Huancuni hacia el norte de Colomi, Doña Sayda se dedica a la producción agrícola tiene ingresos económicos de lo que vende papa, haba, oca, papaliza, de esta forma ella mantiene a sus hijos, la señora Sayda necesita un crédito para obra fina de su vivienda en Sacaba que la hizo construir recientemente y no le alcanzo por que el ahorro que tenía invirtió todo en la obra gruesa, además en otras Entidades Financieras resulta que les pidieron muchos requisitos para sacar un préstamo, como también nos cuenta que su esposo viajo a trabajar al extranjero (Argentina) hasta fines de este año ya que tuvieron mucho gasto últimamente y así van a poder mantener el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sayda is 30 years old and has lived together with her partner Sabino for more than 15 years and has three dependent children who are studying in school.  They live in a rural community called Huancuni in the northern part of Colomi. Sayda works in the field of agriculture and makes a living through the sales of potatoes, broad beans, and other traditional tubers, called oca and papaliza in order to provide for her children.  

Sayda needs this loan because she wants to do the finish work on her house in Sacaba, which they started building recently and never finished because they had invested all of their savings in the major construction, and also because in other financial institutions they ask for a lot of collateral to get a loan, and she also says that her husband traveled to go work in another country (Argentina) until the end of they year, since they have had many expenses lately and this will allow them to keep their children in school.

loans.use: for good construction of her house.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos quienes ya son adultos, la venta de las tortillas la administra como una fuente para atraer ingresos a la familia, es la manera de subsistir que tiene reina.

Solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la compra de maíz, leña, y algunos utensilios plásticos, que son necesarios para almacenar las tortillas, este préstamo le ayudara con los recursos económicos que necesita y poderlos invertir en los materiales para el negocio, aumentando así la producción de las tortillas.

Su objetivo es mejorar sus ingresos a través del fortalecimiento del negocio y del uso de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Reina makes a living selling tortillas.  She lives with her husband and two sons who are now adults.  The sale of tortillas is how her family makes an income - it is how Reina supports them.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase corn, wood, and plastic utensils which are necessary to store the tortillas.  This loan will provide Reina the economic resources necessary to invest in supplies thus increasing tortilla production.  

Her objective is to increase her income by strengthening her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, and plastic utensils.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is an artisan who specializes in tooled leather home accents. He would like to purchase raw materials such as high quality leather, wood, and dye to expand production.

Oscar has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

When Oscar was 10 years old his father died, leaving him no choice but to work at different jobs. One day, when he was 12, he came upon a carpentry shop where he discovered his love for working with wood and leather. He resolved to master the craft, and he did so on his own, learning each step and improving every detail. Today, Oscar has his own workshop. He sees his work as an art form, and not just something to be sold. His says his work fills his life in a way he cannot explain.

"Thank you very much for being a part of this interest-free microcredit project in support of artisans. We don't have big factories and we don't have big machines. We practically do everything with our hands. There are periods where we fall on hard times, so I am happy to know there are people such as you out there who will heed our call."

Use the link below to view Oscar's tooled leather creations on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4344

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his tooled leather crafts in order to expand production

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 34 years old and married, with four children. 

She runs a retail store to earn extra income. She started operating this five years ago and keeps it going. She earns PHP 4,000 a month. She is borrowing PHP 5,000, which she will use to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

She hopes that this investment will make sense and help improve her business operations.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is from Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. Gilbert owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gilbert has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2010, Gilbert joined GDMPC. Gilbert is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.es: La señora Eustaquia tiene 54 años de edad viuda hace 3 años atrás vive sola en una comunidad rural 2da Candelaria sindicato Alto San Isidro hacia el norte de Colomi hace años, no sabe leer ni escribir. La señora muy responsable con sus obligaciones con su actividad económica de producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, papaliza lo cual contrata personal eventual para preparación de terreno, siembra, labores culturales, tratamientos fitosanitarios y cosecha, cuenta con cabezas de ganado vacuno 2 lecheras más 2 de engorde; Doña Eustaquia necesita recursos para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa, ella nos comenta con este crédito va salir adelante mejorando siempre su producción agrícola sembrar en más superficies ya que su única hija que vivía con ella se concubino y quiere ayudarla para que tenga un mejor futuro y que tengan una casa propia en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Eustaquia is 54 years old and was widowed about three years ago and lives alone in the rural community of the Segunda Candelaria a neighborhood of Alto San Isidro on the northern part of Colomi, where she has been for years.  She doesn't know how to read or write.  She is a very responsible woman about her obligations and her primary economic activity is the production of potatoes, broad beans, and other traditional tubers, called oca and papaliza, for which she contracts temporary laborers for the preparation of the fields, sowing, traditional day labor, herbicidal treatments, and the harvest.  She also has several head of cattle, including two milch cows and two who are pregnant.

Eustaquia needs resources to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure) and potatoes for planting.  She says that this loan will help her to get ahead and improve her future agricultural plantings by sowing in more areas, since her only daughter who was living with her became partnered and she wants to help her daughter have a better future and get her own house in the city.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure) and potatoes for planting.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and has two children. She lives in Laperian, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 

Maria owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of shoes to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 12,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2010, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings in her shoe stall.

loans.name: Deena

texts.en:
Deena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pottery business in the Philippines.

Deena requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery business. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Deena would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a business making and selling fermented fish in the Philippines.

Jelly requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her fermented fish. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Jelly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her fermented fish.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel lives in Alegria, Aurora. For four years, she has provided motor rental services to earn money to support the needs of her child. She earns an income of 15,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 25-year old mother, there’s nothing that can make her happier than to see her child successful.

Without hesitation, Ethel is borrowing 25,000 PHP from GDMPC to repair the transport vehicle used in her business. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Her plan for the future is to hopefully improve her business and provide her child a better education.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Aprilla

texts.en:
Aprilla works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit and vegetable retail business in the Philippines.

Aprilla requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene 37 años, estudio hasta el nivel bachillerato, no curso el nivel universitario, se caso con la señora Nora, con el cual vive y tienen tres hijas, las cuales estudian en un colegio fiscal de la zona en nivel primario, actualmente su situación económica es estable, esto es gracias a que en años anteriores el esposo viajo a trabajar a Argentina para mejorar sus ingresos y ahorrar; una vez que regreso sus ahorros fueron destinados para la compra de ganado vacuno. Actualmente la familia vive en Cochabamba y todos colaboran en la actividad de producción de leche. Don Juan con el deseo de mejorar su situación para brindar a su familia una mejor vida. El crédito que solicita es para compra de una chala para alimentar al ganado, debido a que el cliente recibió una oferta de su vecino para la compra de la misma.
texts.en:
Juan is 37. He received his high school diploma, but didn't go on to attend university. He is married to Nora, whom he lives with. They have three daughters, who study at a local public school at the primary level.

Currently their economic situation is stable. This is thanks to the fact that in previous years the husband travelled to Argentina to work, in order to better his income and save. Once he returned, his savings were earmarked for the purchase of cattle. 

Currently, the family lives in Cochabamba, and they all work together in the business of milk production. Juan works with the desire to improve his situation in order to offer his family a better life.

The loan he is requesting is to buy corn husks for feeding the cattle, due to the fact that he received an offer from his neighbor to purchase these.

loans.use: To buy corn husks for cattle feed.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a home products sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional plastic wares to sell to her customers.

NWTF is relisting Cecilia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic wares to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita tiene 56 años es soltera y no tiene hijos, pero se ha hecho cargo de su sobrina que es la hija de su hermana mayor, vive en la provincia de Punata de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aún vive en la casa de su  madre, mantiene y cuida a su madre ya que hace varios años atrás se quedó viuda, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, cuenta con cabezas de ganado lechero y el producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos.
El destino del crédito es para la compra de forraje, ya que esta temporada hay una fuerte escases de forraje y lo que la señora Margarita desea es acumular forraje y de esa manera tendrá la misma alimentación y continuar produciendo la misma cantidad de leche.
Entre sus metas esta seguir cuidando a su madre hasta la hora de su muerte y que la sobrina a la cual mantiene tenga una carrera profesional para que de esa manera pueda tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita, 56, is single and has no children but she cares for her oldest sister’s daughter.  She lives in the city of Cochabamba’s Punata Province and still lives in her mother’s house.  She supports and cares for her mother who was widowed several years ago.  Her main activity is raw milk production.  She owns dairy cattle and sells the milk to a firm that makes dairy products.

The loan will be used to buy forage because it’s scarce this time of year and Margarita wants to acquire it so that she can continue feeding her cattle and producing the same amount of milk.  Among her goals is to continue caring for her mother for the rest of her life and that her niece attains a professional career so that she can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy forage for her cattle.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Theresa is 34 years old and four of her children are in school.

Ma. Theresa has a fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Nora tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera. Trabaja junto con su hermano cultivando hortalizas, como pepino, tomate y chile verde. Ella se involucro hace tres años a este trabajo, antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los quehaceres domésticos en su casa. 

Todos los insumos los compra en una ciudad del oriente del país, su hermano tiene vehiculo y se trasladan juntos a realizar las compras.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar un repuesto para reparar el vehiculo, ya que es  a través del cual trasportan la mercadería, llevan a vender las hortalizas y para una parte de la pared de su casa que se le ha caído el repello. Así, estarán más seguros, cómodos sin poner en riesgo a su familia y sin dejar de vender su cosecha por estar en mal estado su vehiculo. Su deseo es cambiar el vehiculo, quizás dentro de un año, dependerá de cómo vaya creciendo su negocio y de las necesidades que se le presenten.
texts.en:
Nora is 46 years old and single.  She works with her brother growing produce like cucumbers, tomatoes, and green peppers.  She has been involved in this business for the past three years, before which she worked doing the housework for her home.

All of the inputs that she uses are bought in a city in the east of the country.  Her brother has a vehicle and they go together to make their purchases.

The loan she is asking for is to buy a part to repair that vehicle, because it is their means of transporting their merchandise, and for taking their produce to sell, and for repairs to a part of the wall of her house where the plaster has fallen off.  This will make them more secure and comfortable without putting her family at risk of having to stop selling their harvested good because of the poor condition of their vehicle.  Her hope is to change to a new vehicle, hopefully in the next year, though it will depend on how quickly their business grows and what other necessities present themselves in the meantime.

loans.use: to buy a spare part to repair her vehicle, since it's the one she uses to transport her merchandise, take her produce to sell, and the repair a part of the wall of her house where the plaster has fallen off.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es: Rosa Maribel, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo, vive en Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Rosa se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos pero por necesidad de obtener ingresos hace un año hizo la inversión estableciendo su propio negocio donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar en su aldea. Vende granos básicos, manteca, churros, refrescos, salsina, azúcar, arroz, etc. esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar más productos y surtir el negocio para incrementar las ventas, de esta manera ella va obtener más ingresos para el hogar. Su meta es crecer como microempresaria y generar ingresos para su familia y tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Maribel, 26, is a single mother; she has one son.  She lives in Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  Rosa used to work as a domestic employee but needing to earn income started her own business a year ago where she sells basic staple items in her village.  She sells basic grains, lard, snacks, soft-drinks, salsina [spice mix], sugar, rice, etc.

She’s asking for a 10,000 lempira loan to buy more products to stock her business and increase sales in order to produce more household income.  Her goal is to grow as a micro businesswoman and to generate income for her family and to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Gristela De La Flor

texts.es:
Gristela tiene 27 años y es una madre soltera con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Ella vive con su hijo de 1 año, en casa de su padre que esta hecha de material rustico en el puebloe de Tucume, en el Norte del Peru. A pesar de las condiciones humildes, hay un ambiente familiar  y se aprecia bastante voluntad para sus actividades laborales y  cooperacion con sus vecinos quienes dan muy buenas referencias. 
Precisamente, en uno de los cuartos de la casa lo ha habilitado para una pequeña tienda, en la cual expende abarrotes, verduras y bebidas. Lleva ya 4 años aproximadamente con esta actividad y ha podido consolidar su negocio al seguir consiguendo una clientela fiel. Para seguir haciendo mejoras en su negocio Gristela busca tomar un credito de 1000 soles con Edpyme Alternativa. Dicho prestamo sera invertido en compra de mercadería y  asi ampliar su invetario, y asi mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Gristela is a 27 year old single mother with ambitions to improve her livelihood.  She lives with her one year old son in her father's rustic home located in the village of Túcume in Northern Peru.  Despite her humble conditions there is a friendly environment where her work is appreciated.  In addition, her neighbors serve as very good references.  

She converted one of the rooms of her home into a small kiosk in which she sells snacks, vegetables, and drinks.  She has been doing this for approximately four years and has been able to build her business with loyal customers.  In order to continue improving her business Gristela is seeking a loan of 1,000 Sols with Edpyme Alternativa.  This loan will be invested in the purchase of goods to expand her inventory allowing her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase goods to expand the product offering in her store.

loans.name: La Victoire Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA VICTOIRE est formé de sept personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Clarice Ekundayo est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Clarice Ekundayo est âgée de 40 ans, et est mariée à un certain Aurélier. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Clarice Ekundayo n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Il y a douze ans, Clarice Ekundayo vend du riz, des condiments et des charbons de bois à son domicile et par le système de distribution ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Clarice Ekundayo achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la sixième fois que Clarice Ekundayo et les autres membres du groupe LA VICTOIRE sollicitent un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Les cinq premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group La Victoire  [“victory”]  is composed of seven persons living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, by the name of Clarice Ekundayo, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Clarice Ekundayo is 40 years old and is married to a certain Aurelier. They have three children, some of whom are in school and all of whom are in their care. Clarice Ekundayo did not attend school. The children live together with the parents. For 12 years, Clarice Ekundayo has been selling rice, condiments and charcoal out of her home as well as through a distribution system; this allows her to provide for various household needs jointly with her husband. Clarice Ekundayo stocks up at a market in Benin. This is the sixth time that Clarice Ekundayo and the other members of the La Victoire group are seeking a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their businesses in order to better meet customer demand. The five prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy rice, condiments and charcoal.

loans.name: Adilia Natalia

texts.es:
Adilia Natalia, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada desde hace 20 años, tiene seis hijos con edades desde 2 a 21 años, dos de ellos están estudiando, vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Su esposo se desempeña como guardia de seguridad en una empresa privada. 
Adilia tiene su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace mas de 9 años, elabora tortillas de maíz normal y especial para elaborar tacos. Atiende a sus clientes todo el día, cuenta con dos personas más quienes le ayudan en el negocio. Ella ha sido un excelente cliente  y muy puntual en los pagos en la Institución a la fecha a soliictado 13 prestamos. En el mes de febrero del presente  año ella solicito un préstamo de 7,000 lempiras el cual invirtió en la compra de insumos para elaborar las tortillas para la venta. Este préstamo le ayudo mucho a incrementar las ventas y logro pagar el préstamo. En la actualidad esta solicitando otro préstamo de 8000 lempiras para comprar más insumos como Maíz, y también para darle mantenimiento al molino donde muele el maíz  para elaborar las tortillas. Con esta inversión tendrá el insumo necesario para seguir atendiendo la demanda de los clientes y el molino le funcionara sin problema para seguir trabajando.
Su meta es seguir trabajando con los prestamos que odef le proporciona, y seguir creciendo económicamente para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Adilia Natalia, 39, has been married for 20 years; she has six children whose ages range from 2 to 21 years.  Two of them are studying.  She lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.  Her husband works as a security guard in a private firm.

Adilia has her own business: she’s been making tortillas to sell for more than nine years.  She makes normal corn tortillas and special ones for tacos.  She tends to customers all day and has two people who help her with the business.  

She’s been an excellent client; she’s very punctual with her payments to the institution and to date has requested 13 loans.  In February of this year she asked for a 7,000 lempira loan that she used to buy ingredients to make tortillas to sell.  This loan helped her to increase sales and she was able to repay the loan.  

On this occasion, she’s asking for another loan for 8,000 lempiras to buy more ingredients like corn and also to repair the mill she uses to grind the corn to make tortillas.  With this investment she’ll have the necessary ingredients to continue meeting customer demand and the mill will function problem-free in order to continue working.  Her goal is to continue working with the ODEF loans provides and to continue growing economically for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas and to repair her corn mill.

loans.name: Silbano

texts.es: El señor Silbano de 30 años de edad de estado civil soltero con una instrucción de nivel primario, vive junto a sus padres hace 8 años muy independiente económicamente en la comunidad de 2da Candelaria sindicato Piyurata hacia el norte de Colomi. El señor Silbano es una persona joven muy trabajador y responsable con su actividad agrícola anualmente percibe ingresos de la venta de papa, haba en vaina verde, papaliza, siembran con rotación de cultivos en 1,5 has de terreno herencia de sus padres, joven Silbano necesita insumos agrícolas abono orgánico (gallinaza) más productos agroquímicos ya que en otras entidades se le hizo muy difícil les pidieron muchos requisitos. Por último se siente muy feliz al haber tenido esta oportunidad ya que el joven tiene un sueño de sembrar en más superficies hasta tener una casa propia así para vivir más cómodo.
texts.en:
Silbano is 30 years old and single with a primary school education, and lives with his parents, but has been economically independent for the past eight years in the community of Segunda Candelaria a nieghborhood of Piyurata in the northern part of Colomi. Silbano is a young, responsible, and hardworking person who receives an annual income from his agricultural crops and the sales of his potatoes, lima beans, and the traditional tubers called papaliza, which he plants in a rotation on his 1.5 hectares of land that he inherited from his parents.

Young Silbano needs agricultural inputs like organic fertilizer (chicken manure) and other agricultural chemicals, since he has found it hard to ask for resources from many other institutions.  Finally, he feels very happy to have had this opportunity, since he has a dream of planting more lands in order to buy a home of his own in which to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure).

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SAN PEDRO,  Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Lizet tiene 32 años, y dos hijos que son de las edades de 10 y 15 años,  La Sra. Lizet se dedica  a la   venta de ropa según la temporada, ella tiene un puesto fijo en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lizet va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada por mayor como ser chompas y chamarras para combatir esta época de invierno y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Lizet va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa según la temporada, la Sra. Lizet es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "San Pedro" communal bank is made up of nine members: seven women and two men. The chairperson of the bank is Lizet. She is 32, and has two children, ages 10 and 15. 

Lizet sells clothing according to the season. She has a permanent stand where she sells her goods, located in one of the busiest markets in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan with the institution. 

Lizet is going to use this loan to buy seasonal clothing at wholesale, such as sweaters and jackets to combat this winter season. This will enable her to offer a variety of clothing to her customers and increase her earnings. 

Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Lizet is going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of clothing according to the season. 

Lizet is a very hard-working person. She feels happy about the opportunity provided to her and her fellow group members, as in some cases they are the sole support of their families.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Isrrael

texts.es: Israel tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero por viudez, vive en Morazan, Yoro,  junto a un hijo que tiene a su cargo. Don Israel hace 10 años que se dedica al cultivo de café, anteriormente se dedicaba a cultivar granos básicos y al comercio. Su producción la vende en el mercado local. El solicita un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos e insumos para la finca de café. El necesita abonar su cultivo aprovechando el buen tiempo y poder esperar una buena producción de calidad y vender mejor. Su meta es ayudar a todos sus hijos a que siembren su propia parcela de café.
texts.en: Israel, 47, is single because he’s a widower; he lives in Morazán, Yoro, with a son who is still in his care.  Israel has been a coffee grower for the last ten years.  He used to grow basic grains and was a merchant.  He sells his production in the local market.  He’s asking for a 7,000 lempira loan to buy manure and supplies for his coffee crops.  He needs to fertilize the crops taking advantage of the good weather to expect a good quality harvest and better sales.  His goal is to help all of his children to plant their own fields of coffee.

loans.use: to buy manure and farm supplies.

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es: Justiniano, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en Morazan Yoro junto a su conyugue y sus 4 hijos. Justiniano tiene 5 años de dedicarse a su propia actividad agrícola, principalmente el cultivo de café, el tiene 2  manzanas de terreno donde realiza el cultivo de café. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Su finca a mejorado, las ganancias del préstamo anterior fueron invertidas  también en  la finca y actualmente necesita volver a fertilizar y abonar el cultivo, para lo cual solicita este otro préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras. Esperando que su finca mejore y sacar buenas cosechas. Su meta es ampliar y mejorar la producción para poderle dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: Justiniano, 29, lives in Morazán, Yoro, with his spouse and their four children.  Justiniano has been working in his own agriculture business for five years, mainly growing coffee.  He has two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of land planted with coffee.  He sells his harvests in the local market.  His farm has improved and profits from the previous loan were reinvested in the farm.  He currently needs to fertilize and apply manure to the crops again for which he needs another 7,000 lempira loan.  He hopes the farm will improve and his harvests will be good.  His goal is to expand and improve production to give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Altemira

texts.es:
Altermira es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad, reside junto a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos que aun mantiene a su cargo en el distrito de La Matanza, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia de Morropón, en la región Piura. 

Al igual que la mayor parte de mujeres que viven en la zona, se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ovejas, cabras y gallinas. Ella mantiene esta actividad desde hace mas de cinco años y se vale de ella para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar, su esposo es obrero en una fábrica de la ciudad de Piura.

Altemira se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 4000 nuevos soles. Ella desea adquirir materiales de contrucción como ladrillos y cemento, con los cuales espera levantar algunas pareder y arreglar las ventanas de su domicilio. de esa forma ella piensa mejorar en parte la condicion de vida con la que cuenta actaualmente.

Uno de sus objetivos primordiales es poder aumentar las ventas de sus animales, por lo que para lograrlo se esfuerza tratando siempre de conseguirles alimento balanceado y buscando nuevos clientes que estén dispuestos a adquirir los animales que ofrece. En la zona ella es bastante conocida y respetada.
texts.en:
Altemire is a 55 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and one of her sons whom she looks after in the district of La Matanza, an agricultural district located in the Morropón province in the Piura region.  

Most women in her area make a living selling sheep, goats, and chickens.  She has been doing this for over five years to help her husband financially maintain their home.  Her husband works in a factory in Piura city.  

Altemira is seeking a loan of 4000 Sols from Epdyme Alternativa.  She wishes to purchase construction materials like bricks and cement with which she hopes to fix some of the walls and windows in her home.  In this way she will improve her quality of life

One of her primary objectives is to increase her livestock sales which she highly cares for by always feeding them well.  She is always looking for new customers who are willing to purchase the livestock she offers.  She is well-known and respected in her community.

loans.use: to purchase bricks and cement to improve her home.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo tiene 67 años, hace muchos años que se separó de su pareja, no tiene hijos. Actualmente vive en la compañía de los inquilinos que tiene en su casa.
Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a la agricultura. Su distrito es una zona de tierras fértiles, por ello Marcelo aprovecha esto y produce papas y avena. Cada vez que cosecha lleva su producción hasta el mercado de la ciudad, donde vende al por mayor. A pesar de su edad continúa cogiendo las herramientas y cuida de sus cultivos: “me gusta estar ocupado, si no trabajo me siento inútil”, menciona. Su casa es grande y alquila habitaciones, de ahí obtiene ingresos mensuales, además el estado le brinda una pensión de jubilación. Aún así labora con esmero porque es un hombre que no se cansa fácilmente.

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza de Huaricolca”, este es su crédito número 12 con MFP y se siente a gusto de tener socios con proyecciones de trabajo similares.
Marcelo iniciará una siembra de papas del tipo “yungay”, para ello invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes, cuyo precio asciende a 125 soles por saco.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 67. He separated from his wife many years ago. He has no children. Currently, he lives in the company of the renters that he has in his house. 

He has been farming for more than 15 years.  His district is in an area of fertile soil, so Marcelo takes advantage of this to grow potatoes and oats. Each time he harvests he carries his produce to the city market, where he sells at wholesale. 

Despite his age, he continues to take up his tools and look after his crops. “I like to be busy; if I don't work I feel useless," he says. His house is large, and he rents rooms. From this he receives monthly income. In addition, the state provides him with a retirement pension. Even so, he takes great pains with his work, because he is a man who doesn't tire easily. 

He belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza de Huaricolca,” communal bank, and this is his 12th loan with MFP. He feels at ease having co-members with similar business plans.  

Marcelo will begin a planting of “Yungay” type potatoes, and for this he will use the money from the loan to purchase bags of fertilizer, the price of which has reached 125 soles per bag.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.name: Luis Mario Santos

texts.es: Don Luis Mario, de 44 años de edad, casado, con 5 hijos, vive en Intibucá, zona productora de papas. el casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 30 años, comenzó con su padre, luego él se independizo y realiza sus propios cultivos. Produce y vende papas al por mayor en el mercado local. Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras  para comprar semilla certificada de mejor calidad y fertilizantes e insumos para darle mantenimiento al cultivo. Con este préstamo va poder comprar semilla de primera calidad ya que dejara para volver a sembrar el otro ciclo. Su meta es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, ya uno de ellos se gradúa este año.
texts.en:
Luis Mario, 44, is married and has five children.  He lives in Intibucá, a potato producing area.  He’s dedicated most of his life to agriculture, an activity he’s been in for 30 years having started with his father and then becoming independent with his own crops.  He produces and sells potatoes at wholesale in the local market.

He’s currently asking for a 20,000 lempira loan to buy certified, higher quality seeds, fertilizer and farm supplies to provide crop maintenance.  He’ll be able to buy top quality seeds with this loan to use in his next planting cycle.  His goal is that his children continue studying; one of them will be graduating this year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 57 años de edad, es madre de un hijo. Se dedica a la venta de ropa como blusas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, pantalones para dama, entre otros artículos más. Ella tiene cuatro rutas de venta bien definidas, las cubre saliendo un día de por medio a cada ruta, sin un día especifico para cada ruta; lo que si es seguro es el horario de 6:30 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. los días que no vende ropa son martes, jueves y domingo, estos días por lo general vende tamales, tostadas, yuca frita, pasteles y pan  dulce en su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar al mayoreo ropa para hombre como calcetines, camisas, ropa interior y sobre todo pantalones jeans, ya que nos comenta que es el que le deja mejores ganancias. Además, siempre mantendrá su venta de comida típica en la casa y terminara de cancelar la deuda que tiene con la fundación. 

Ella con la inversión pretende aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta el mercado y el tiempo que se aproxima, pues manifiesta que las ventas se incrementan, obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos que ayude a su estabilidad y calidad de vida. María desea  comprar ropa para bebes pues es un buen mercado.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and the mother of one child.  She is a saleswoman of clothing like shirts, underwear for women and men, pants for women, and many other items.  She has four distinct routes that she covers by going along each route for about a half a day.  She doesn't have a specific day for each route, but she is certain to work every day from 6:30 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. The days she doesn't sell clothing are Tuesday, Thursday, and Sunday, and those days she generally sells tamales, tostadas, fried yucca, cakes, and sweets from her home.

The loan she is asking for from Fundación Campo is going to buy men's clothing in bulk, like socks, shirts, underwear, and especially jeans, since she tells us that this is what gives her the greatest profits.  Also, she will maintain her traditional food business in her home and finish paying off the debt she has from the foundation.

With her investment, she is intending to take the opportunity that she has in the market and with the time that she has to work, she says that her sales are growing and she is making a better income that are helping her become more stable and have a better quality of life.  María wants to buy baby clothes as well, but in a good market.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing in bulk, like socks, shirts, underwear, and most of all jeans, since this is what she says brings in her greatest profits.

loans.name: Maidy Waleska

texts.es: Maidy, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una colonia Suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a su madre, abuela e hijo. Maidy estuvo trabajando en una empresa privada, y necesitaba estar en casa al cuidado de su madre e hijo, y decidió establecer su propio negocio para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar, como ser: harina, curros, refrescos, dulces, arroz, azúcar, manteca, consomé, pastillas, pan etc. de este negocio ella obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir gastos del hogar de su familia. Le dedica todo el día y esta al cuidado de su familia. Solicita un préstamo por 6,500 Lempiras para surtir la pulpería de productos comestibles de primera necesidad. Su plan es seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en: Maidy, 28, is a single mother living in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with her mother, her grandmother and her son.   Maidy used to work for a private firm but needed to stay at home to care for her mother and son so decided to open her own business selling basic staple items like flour, snacks, soft-drinks, candy, rice, sugar, lard, consommé, pills, bread, etc.  From this business she earns income needed to cover her household family needs.  She spends all day at work and caring for her family.  She’s asking for a 6,500 lempira loan to stock her grocery store with basic staple items.  Her plan is to continue growing in the business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martín tiene 33 años de edad, es casado  y no tiene hijos por ahora, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa. La zona en donde reside es uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, aunque en la zona ya cuentan con servicios de agua y luz, la comunidad sigue siendo bastante humilde y costumbrista, al igual que las zonas aledañas.

Martín se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales desde hace 10 años, el cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Su especialidad son los pavos, con los cuales se obtienen bastantes ganancias una vez que sean vendidos, adicionalmente labora como agricultor, ya que tiene un pequeño terreno en donde siembra granos y menestras dos veces al año.   

El se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 4000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en compra de aves para engorde, alimento balanceado para aves, cerdos y además para empezar a sembrar su "campaña chica" (siembra de menestras, las cuales se pueden cosechar muy rápido). 

Con esta incersión el pogresará como empresario y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida. Martín agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyen con el presente préstamo.
texts.en:
Martín is 33 years old, married, and doesn't yet have any children.  He lives in his own home along with his wife.  The neighborhood in which he lives is one of those that makes up the rural area of the district of Mórrope.  Though in this zone they now have water and electricity, the community continues to be very traditional and humble, just as the zones nearby are.

Martín has been a grower and salesman of animals for the past ten years.  He raises his animals in corrals located on his property, and when they have grown to a good size, he offers them for sale to the buyers in his area and in the largest market in the city of Chiclayo. 

His specialty is the raising of turkeys, with which he is able to get sufficient earnings when he sells them, and he also works as a farmer, since he has a small amount of land on which he grows various grains and a variety of vegetables twice a year.

He is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 4,000 Soles, which he intends to invest in buying birds to sell, balanced feed for his birds, pigs, and also to begin the planting of his small plot of land (the planting of various vegetables, which he will be able to harvest quickly).

With this addition, he will become a better businessman and be able to improve his quality of life.  Martín is thankful for the helping hand of the people who are supporting him with this current loan.

loans.use: Compra de aves para engorde, alimento balanceado para aves, cerdos y además para empezar a sembrar su "campaña chica" (siembra de menestras, las cuales se pueden cosechar muy rápido).

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Today Accion funded an existing wholesale business in Miami!  Bernardo is the proud owner of B&B Logistic.  His business distributes food to grocery stores, mini markets, laundry mats and dry cleaning businesses.  Hear what his clients say about him: “Bernardo provides excellent service, he anticipates our needs, is always on time and most of all shows a great level of professionalism. I feel that I can trust him and that he is of the highest integrity”.  Also hear what his ex–manager says about him: “Bernardo always had the heart of an entrepreneur, when he worked for us we could see this, and for that reason we pushed him to pursue the dream of owning his own business. We pushed him to become a wholesaler and take advantage of the many years in the field. This is probably the key to his success.”

Bernardo started his business with years of experience in wholesale distribution.   For many years, he worked for a company called REX, a local wholesaler of various products.   After many years of working for this company, as mentioned in the quote above, the owners pushed him to form his own corporation, and to use his experience and heart to start his own business. He has had tremendous success in a short period of time.  He quickly established a steady flow of clientele in South Florida. An Accion loan will help Bernardo to purchase inventory and more importantly to establish his personal credit.  Bernardo needs to build his credit to be able to pursue further financial opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and improve his personal credit standing

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория живет с муже и сыном. Муж работает на угольной шахте шахтером.

Виктория продает детскую одежду для мальчиков. Ее киоск находитсяа рынке. Раньше она арендовала его, но затем договорилась с владельцем, чтобы приобести его в рассрочку. За несколько лет она смогла выплатить стоимость киоска и теперь экономит на аренде. 

Виктория торгует более 5 лет, у нее много постоянных клиентов и бизнес идет хорошо. Виктория просит предоставить ей кредит на расширение бизнеса. Она хочет расширить киоск, чтобы можно было выкладывать больше одежды. Такмм образом Виктория надеется увеличить продажи и соответственно свою прибыль.
texts.en: Victoria lives together with her husband and son.  Her husband works as a miner at a coal mine.  Victoria sells children's clothing for boys.  Her kiosk is located at market.  She previously leased it, but then reached an agreement with its owner to finance its purchase.  She was able to pay off the cost of the kiosk within several years and can now save by not paying lease.  Victoria has been involved in sales for over five years, has many clients, and her business is going well.  She is requesting this loan to expand her business.  She wants to expand her kiosk in order to set out more clothing there.  This is how Victoria hopes to increase her sales and, thus, her profit.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, shorts, pants and athletic uniforms

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a business buying and selling fermented fish in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her fermented fish.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 21 years now and also earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her fermented fish ('guinamos').

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 61 years old, married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a dry goods retail business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dry goods to sell to customers.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a variety store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell in her store.

NWTF is listing Emelia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Padppa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe PADPPA est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Justine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Justine est âgée de 60 ans et est une veuve. Justine est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés, dont un reste à sa charge. Justine vit seule avec son enfant. Pour assurer les diverses charges de la maison, Justine vend des crevettes et des poissons dans un quartier du Bénin. Justine s’approvisionne dans un quartier du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Justine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe PADPPA, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The PADPPA group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the fifth time that the group is requesting financial aid from Alidé to increase the level of their business. The representative of the group, Justine, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. Justine is 60 years old and a widow. She is a mother of five school-aged children, one of whom is still under her care. Justine lives alone with her child. To provide for her various household needs, Justine sells shrimp and fish in a neighborhood of Bénin. She gets her supply in a district of Bénin. To keep her customers satisfied and to increase her income and revenue, Justine and the other members of the PADPPA group are requesting a fifth loan from Alidé. The funds they received previously have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
For the past 15 years Editha, a 56-year-old married mother of one, has been earning a living by raising and selling livestock in the Philippines. She also sells coconuts.

Editha is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise and sell. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Leticia Blanca

texts.es: Leticia tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada y con 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en Tambogrande en la provincia de Piura al Norte del Peru. Clienta vive en la parte  rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicio de luz. Entre ella y su familia se apoyan para salir adelante. Leticia en particular desarrolla actividades en la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, caprino y porcino), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con más de 10 años en el negocio y se ha convertido en una parte crucial para el desarrollo economico de su familia. Mientras tanto, su esposo es agricultor, con parcela propia, en donde tiene sembrado mango y pan llevar (legumbres). También trabaja en un fundo agrícola como peón estable. Entre los dos viven en armonia y demuestran que a pesar de la humildes condiciones, es posible vivir en un hogar, con energia y con vision para el futuro. Pensando en ello, ella esta solicitando un credito de 2000 soles para la compra alimento balanceado para su ganado menor.
texts.en:
Leticia is 41, married, and has two children in her care. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. The house is located in Tambogrande, in Piura province in northern Peru. The client lives in the rural part of the district and has no electricity service. Between her and her family, they support one another in moving forward. 

Leticia in particular works raising small livestock: sheep, goats and pigs. When they reach ideal weight and size, she sells them at the local market. She has more than ten years in the business, and has become a crucial part of her family's livelihood. In the meantime, her husband is a farmer; with his own piece of land, where he has planted mango, and staple crops such as vegetables. 

He also has steady work on a farm. The two of them live in harmony, and demonstrate that despite humble circumstances, it is possible to live in a home, with vitality and a vision for the future.

With this in mind, she is requesting a loan of 2000 soles for the purchase of balanced feed for her small livestock.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her small livestock.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена благодарна за предыдущий КИВА кредит. Она удачно его вложила и получила дополнительную прибыль. В этот раз Елена просит предоставить ей кредит на летнее постельное белье, а также купальники, летнюю обувь и шорты.

Елена - отличная мать. Она помогает своей дочери, которая недавно вышла замуж, делать ремонт в квартире. Ее дочь ждет сейчас ребенка и скоро Елена станет бабушкой.

Часть прибыльи Елена хочет вложить обратно в бизнес, чтобы сделать закупку постельного белья на осень.
texts.en: Yelena is grateful for her previous Kiva loan.  She successfully invested it and made an additional profit.  This time, Yelena is requesting a loan to purchase summer bedding and also swimming suits, summers shoes and shorts.  Yelena is an excellent mother.  She helps her daughter, who recently got married, to make repairs in her apartment.  Her daughter is expecting a child, and Yelena will soon become a grandmother.  Yelena wants to invest some of the profit back into the business in order to make a purchase of bedding for the autumn.

loans.use: to purchase summer bedding, swimming suits, shoes and shorts

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Rudy is married and has three children. Rudy is 61 years old, residing at San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Rudy owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns 9,000 PHP doing this business. 

Rudy requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Rudy been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Rudy wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is from Alang-alang, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old. Elvira is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Elvira runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Elvira has been in her business for 16 years and earns 7,430 PHP a month for these activities.

Elvira is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Elvira joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Rechel Jean

texts.en:
Rechel Jean works hard to support her family. Rechel Jean is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rechel Jean requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, bamboo, and other fishing equipment.

She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Rechel Jean would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, bamboo and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Jasmani

texts.es:
Jasmani tiene 25 años, su pareja es Lizbeth, con quien tiene un hijo. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado Villa Ashaninka (selva central).
Hace 7 años que se dedica a la agricultura. Produce café, plátanos y naranjas, en tres parcelas de terrenos que la comunidad le otorgó. Él es muy responsable, este mes tenía que cubrir un pedido de café que le hizo un centro de acopio, por ello tuvo que permanecer día y noche en sus terrenos para cumplir. Ahora ya terminó la cosecha de café y se esmera en cuidar sus frutas, ya que en todos los meses del año puede negociarlas. Su tarea más urgente es limpiar sus cultivos que quedaron maltratados por la última cosecha. Para el futuro desea adquirir otro terreno de cultivos para plantar más frutas.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se siente a gusto de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Los Naranjales”, donde es el presidente del grupo y cumple sus obligaciones con responsabilidad.
El dinero de este préstamo lo usará en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de los arbustos y mala hierba de sus cultivos de café y naranjas.
texts.en:
Jasmani is 25 years old. His partner's name is Lizbeth, and they have a son together. They all live in the house he owns in the small village of Villa Ashaninka, in the central jungle.

He has been a farmer for seven years. He grows coffee, plaintains, and oranges on three plots of land given him by the community. He is very responsible. This month he had to cover an order of coffee beans made by a distribution center, and had to stay on his land day and night in order to get the job done. Now the coffee bean harvest is over and he is dedicated to taking great care of his fruit, since he can sell it any time of the year. His most pressing chore is clearing the crops that were damaged in the last harvest. In the future he would like to acquire another plot of farmland in order to plant more fruit trees. 

This is his second loan with MFP, and he is proud of belonging to his communal bank, Los Naranjales. He is president of the group and fullfills his obligations responsibly.

He will use the money from this loan to pay the laborers he will hire to clear his coffee plantations and orange groves of brush and weeds.

loans.use: to pay the laborers who will work clearing his coffee plantations and orange groves.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is fifty-four years old. She lives in the village of San Martin in the district of Tambogrande, a tropical region of northern Peru populated primarily by small farmers who raise animals and have fruit plantations. She is an extremely hard working woman, who has proven to be very responsible in her previous commitments with Kiva and Edpyme. Moreover, this micro-entrepreneur is well known to have a kind heart and a constant smile.

She lives with her husband and children in a home they own. Rosenda manages a small general store out of the front of her home. She sells various basic items to her neighbors, assisting them in reducing the time it takes to complete their shopping errands. She can be found in her shop daily at almost all hours. 

Rosenda is looking now to take her third loan with Kiva and Edpyme Alternative. She is looking to take a loan of 2000 soles make improvements to her business. She is looking to buy more products as well as a new glass stand to display her products. She is a responsible and dedicated woman who is constantly striving to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase more everyday products and groceries and a display case

loans.name: Firmo Roman

texts.es: El Sr. Firmo es una persona humilde, de Profesión Zapatero hace mas de 17 años que ejerce su Profesión, es casado, su esposa se dedica a la Preparación de Comida Tradicional, tiene dos hijos a quienes apoyan moral y económicamente. Tiene su casita propia que con su esfuerzo y el de su mujer pudieron Construir, ahora solicita el crédito para poder refaccionar algunos cuartos de su Vivienda que con el tiempo se le fueron deteriorando, de esa manera sus hijos estarán mas cómodos y tendrán un lugar donde estudiar y descansar todas las noches. El Sr. Firmo señala que será de mucha utilidad el poder otorgarle el préstamo ya que sin eso no podrá Refaccionar su casita y con el tiempo se le ira destruyendo aun mas, quiere aprovechar que en estos meses no llueve, pues será mas fácil poder avanzar en lo que quiere realizar con su Vivienda y sentirse satisfecho con el logro del mismo.
texts.en:
Firmo is a humble person and works as a cobbler.  It has been more than 17 years that he has been working in his profession.  He is married and his wife works in the preparation of traditional foods.  He has two children who he supports economically and also morally.  He has his own house which was built through the strength of himself and his wife, and he is now asking for a loan in order to refurbish a few rooms of his home that have become deteriorated over the years.  With this improvement, his children will be more comfortable, and they will have a place to study and relax every night.  

Firmo says that it will be a great help to be given this loan, since without it he will not be able to re-do his home and with time it would continue to deteriorate.  He wants to take advantage of the dry months, as it will be easier to make progress in finishing his house, and he will feel happy to successfully complete his repairs.

loans.use: repair his house.

loans.name: Ma. Junita

texts.en:
Ma. Junita works hard to support her family. Ma. Junita is married and has a fruit and vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Ma. Junita has been in this business for 12 years now, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

In the future, Ma. Junita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга замужем. У нее двое взрослых детей. Ольга работает поваром. 

Вместе с мужем она проживает в собственном доме. Ольга предоставить ей кредит в сумме 6000 гривен на замену окон в доме. Новые окна помогут сохранять тепло во время зимы.

У Ольги с мужем есть огород на заднем дворе, где они выращивают небольшое количетво овощей. Ольга планирует дополнительно подрабатывать: купить участок земли  и выращивать на продажу помидоры. Она трудолюбивая и настойчивая.
texts.en: Olga is married and has two adult children.  She works as a cook.  She lives together with her husband in their own home.  Olga is requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 hryvnia to replace windows at home.  New windows would help keep the heat inside during winter.  Olga and her husband have a garden in their back yard, where they grow a small amount of vegetables.  Olga plans to earn more by buying a plot of land and growing tomatoes there for sale.  She is hardworking and persistent.

loans.use: to install energy-efficient windows in her house

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is married and has two children. Arlyn is 40 years old, and resides at Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Arlyn owns and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests rice to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2008, Arlyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Arlyn wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ronna

texts.en:
Ronna is 30 years old and single.

Ronna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20.000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Ronna has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Ronna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jhoselin

texts.es: La Sra. Jhoselin, de estado Civil Soltera, tiene un solo hijo a quien apoya moral y económicamente, solo cuneta con el apoyo de su madre ya que el padre de su hijo le abandono hace dos años atrás. Se dedica a la Venta de juguetes de Madera que su misma madre los Fabrica, le costo salir adelante con el apoyo solo de su madre, por ello solicitado un crédito  para poder ampliar su negocio y poder comprar una mayor cantidad de juguetes de esa manera poder mejorar su estatus de vida y ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor condición social  y poder adquirir una casita con el tiempo lo cual es su gran sueño que en el corto plazo quiere lograrlo, pues a pesar que su madre le trata bien ella quiere tener su propia Vivienda, pues su hijo tendrá un lugar donde poder dormir mas tranquilo y poder estudiar a largo plazo
texts.en:
Jhoselin is a single woman with one child who she supports morally and economically.  She has only the support of her mother, since the father of her child abandoned her about two years ago.  She supports herself through the sale of wooden toys, which her own mother makes.  It is difficult for her to support herself with only the help of her mother, and therefore she is asking for a loan to expand her business and to be able to buy greater quantities of toys.  

Thus, she will improve her quality of life and offer her child a better social status.  And also she wants to buy herself a small house, which is a dream of hers for the future, which she hopes to achieve shortly.
