El necesita el préstamo para sembrar 11/2 manzana de repollo. Pues con el crédito podrá comprar insumos para siembra como semilla, abonos, fertilizantes, espera sacar una producción de mucha calidad y buen rendimiento que le permita mejorar sus ingresos y darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Reynerio is a simple farmer from the Santa Cruz district outside Estelí.  He grows cabbage, potatoes and peppers that are the most popular crops in the region due to the fertile soil apt for this type of crop.  He and his family work the land together in order to plant and produce.  They sell their crops along the highways and to buyers who come by the community looking for fresh products.

He needs the loan in order to plant 1-1/2 manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of cabbage.  The loan will make it possible for him to buy seeds, manure and fertilizer.  He hopes for a very high quality, high yield harvest that will allow him to improve his income and give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.ru:
Василь – бизнесмен из небольшого села Угля, в западной части Украины. Он уже 12 лет работает в своем регионе, занимается разного рода деятельностью: предоставляет грузовые транспортные услуги, перепродает древесину и торгует комбикормами. Одной из главных трудностей в своей работе считает конкуренцию, поэтому и не останавливается на каком-то одном виде предпринимательской деятельности. 

Василь планирует вложить кредит в 5 000 гривен в приобретение большой оптовой партии комбикорма для последующей перепродажи в розницу. Эти закупки будут способствовать развитию его бизнеса, помогая ему улучшить свой уровень жизни. Со временем Василь планирует расширить бизнес за счет открытия нового торгового места на рынке комбикормов в городе Хусте.
texts.en: Vasil is a businessman from a small village, called Uglya, in the Western part of Ukraine.  He has been working in his region for 12 years, being involved in various types of business, such as providing transportation services, reselling wood and selling animal feed.  He considers competition to be one of the primary difficulties in his work and this is why he does not stop on any single type of entrepreneurial focus.  Vasil plans to invest the loan in the amount of 5000 hryvnia into a purchase of a large wholesale inventory of feed for subsequent retail resale.  This purchase would contribute to the development of his business and help him to improve his quality of life.  With time, Vasil plans to expand his business by opening a new retail outlet at the feed market in the city of Khust.

loans.use: to purchase a wholesale inventory of animal feed

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es: Jairo originario del el Dorado comunidad de Estelí, nos expresa que su experiencia con su primer crédito Kiva fue de mucho beneficio para sus siembra pues le permitió mejorar la calidad de sus productos en especial cebollas y no solo le permitió sacar una producción de calidad también logro probarse a si mismo que podía salir adelante y ser responsable con su crédito ya goza de un buen record crediticio. Ahora él quiere sembrar tomates  es por ello que solicita un segundo crédito para comprar semilla de tomates, compra de abono y pago de mano de obra. El espera vender toda su producción a un buen precio, pagar su crédito darse a conocer como productor y lograr ampliar sus áreas de siembra para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jairo is from the community of El Dorado in Estelí department. He tells us that his experience with his first Kiva loan was most beneficial in terms of his crops. It allowed him to improve the quality of his produce, especially onions. 

Not only did it allow him to get quality production, but he also managed to prove to himself that he could succeed and be responsible with his loan. Now  he has a good credit record. 

Now he wants to plant tomatos. That is why he is requesting a second loan, in order to buy tomato seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor. 

He hopes to sell his entire production at a good price, pay off his loan, make a name for himself as a producer, and succeed in expanding the area he has under cultivation so that he can get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy tomato seeds and manure, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Kuña Juky Group

texts.es:
El comité “KUÑA JUKY” se encuentra en el Cuarto ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, y tiene  15 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan arduamente.
Eulalia es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a la venta de cosméticos que hace esta pudiendo salir adelante y ayudar a los suyos. Su meta es darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan y que no pasen por necesidades.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, ya que tiene muchos pedidos con los que quiere cumplir. Eulalia nos dice que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Juky” committee is in its 4th cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women program; it has 15 members who all work very hard. 

Eulalia is a very hardworking person who thanks to the sales of cosmetics is being able to get ahead and help her loved ones.  Her goal is to give her family everything they need so that they will not have to go through any privations.

She’s asking for the loan to buy cosmetics because she has many orders she’d like to fill.  Eulalia tells us that the loan will be of great help to her in order to be closer to reaching her goals more each time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras Medalla Milagrosa tuvo sus inicios en el mes de julio de 2011, actualmente cuenta con 16 integrantes, se encuentran en el 4° ciclo, todas ellas se ayudan y por medio de su gran esfuerzo salen adelante.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Juliana de 49 años,   quien  se dedica al macate desde hace ya varios años, ella realiza las ventas por las zonas de Luque, Mariano Roque Alonso y Ñemby, ya posee tiene una clientela formada, desarrollando este digno trabajo, ella pudo criar a todos sus hijos y hasta ahora es el sostén de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, edredones, colchas, prendas de vestir y demás, ya que esos son sus principales productos para poder vender y de esa forma seguir manteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
This “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) group of enterprising women began in July, 2011.  It currently has 16 members and is in its 4th cycle.  All of them help each other out and get ahead through their great efforts.

One of the stories that’s worthy of highlighting is Juliana’s.  She’s 49-years-old and has been selling assorted merchandise for several years now throughout the areas of Luque, Mariano Roque Alonso and Ñemby.  She has a well-established regular clientele.  By doing this honorable work, she was able to raise all her children and to date is her family’s source of support.

She requests the loan to buy sheets, comforters, bedspreads, clothing and others because these are the main products she sells so that she can continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters, bedspreads, clothing and more.

loans.name: Festival Guarambare Group

texts.es:
El comité Festival Guarambaré tiene 13 integrantes, donde todas ponen todo su esfuerzo y dedicación para poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, ya que quiere darles todo lo que no pudieron tener.
Digna es parte del grupo y cuenta que con su trabajo y sacrificio esta saliendo adelante y ayuda a los suyos. Es una persona que sueña con un mañana mejor para su familia, es por ello que no se cansa.
Digna vende bebidas de todo tipo y es para ello que solicita el crédito, ya que quiere comprar gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás tipos de bebidas para seguir teniendo buenos productos que dar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Guarambaré Festival” committee has 13 members; all of them put in effort and dedication in order to get ahead and help their families since they want to give them everything they themselves never had.

Digna is a group member and she relates that with her work and sacrifice she’s getting ahead and helping all her loved ones.  She’s a person who dreams with a better tomorrow for her family which is why she is tireless.

Digna sells all types of beverages and this is what she’s requesting the loan for because she wants to buy soft-drinks, beer, wine and other types of beverages to continue having good products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, wine, beer and others.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her business selling clothes. She has a great sense of clothing and knows about the latest fashion trend. She is very experienced in her work and has been operating her business for many years.  Her customers like her collection very much and regularly purchase clothes from her.  

With the loan investment, she will buy different varieties of clothes that will allow her to attract more clients and increase her sales and income.

She is confident that by putting the KIVA loan into her business, she will be able to make it more profitable.

loans.use: To buy new varieties of clothes for her business selling clothes.

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah.  She will utilize the loan amount in buying a new sewing machine for her husband.

Her husband is a tailor.  By purchasing a new sewing machine, he will be able to complete client orders on time and increase his income.

He has been operating his business for many years, and he is known as an expert in his field. He has large number of clients who give him regular orders.  EID, a Muslim religious festival, is very near, and he has large number of orders to fulfill.

Maqsoodan is hopeful that by buying a new sewing machine, he will be able to grow his business further and earn great profits this EID.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Medalla Milagrosa ” están  en el Decimo Ciclo con 23  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables.
Irma vende frutas y verduras, y cuenta que por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan. Irma es muy emprendedora y no teme trabajar en lo que sea con tal de ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para un futuro sin privaciones.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras, y de esa forma estar bien surtida para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, y también poder atraer a más.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) and they are in the 10th cycle with 23 members.  It’s a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very unified, supportive and responsible.

Irma sells fruit and vegetables and she relates that she helps her family by means of this work; she gives them everything they need.  Irma is very enterprising and not afraid to work in whatever is necessary in order to help her family and to give them what they need to have a privation-free future.

She asks for the loan to buy fruit and vegetables in order to be well-stocked and offer variety to her customers to also be able to attract more of them.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Guapas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Guapas es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Caacupé con la unión de 14 mujeres con un gran espíritu de lucha y de superación.
Catalina es la presidenta, ella trata siempre de apoyar e incentivar a sus amigas a que no se rindan y que sigan luchando por sus familias. Ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y nos cuenta que le va bien porque tiene buena clientela que se gano por su habilidad para las ventas y por la buena calidad de sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes de todas marcas, para que de esa forma siga trabajando. Catalina nos dice que siente mucho orgullo por lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honesto.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Guapas” (Good-Looking Women) is the group formed in the city of Caacupé by 14 women with a great drive to succeed and get ahead.
Catalina is group president.  She always tries to support and encourage her girlfriends so that they won’t give up and continue striving for their families.  

She sells perfume and relates that she does well because she has a good clientele that she won over because of her sales skills and because of the good quality of her products.

She asked for the loan to buy all brands of perfume so that she can continue to work.  Catalina relates that she is very proud of what she does because it’s honest, proper work.

loans.use: to buy perfume to resell.

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Las Exitosas"tiene mas de 2 años de formación y trabájo con al Fundación Paraguaya, y gracias a este trabajo unido que haces pueden ayudar más de lo que piensas a sus familias.
La Sra. Consorcia es una  integrante de éste comité , se unió al grupo por la necesidad de tener un trabajo que le permita generar mas ingresos , para solventar los gastos de la casa, y tambien la educación de sus hijos , ya que es madre soltera y jefa de hogar.Se dedica a la venta de ropas nuevas y usadas . Anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días para darles la oportunidad de estudiar y lograr un futuro mejor. Solicita el crédito para comprar prendas, y venderlas y de esa forma seguir creciendo como persona y trabajadora.
texts.en:
The “Las Exitosas” (The Successful Ones) committee has been together and working with Fundación Paraguaya for more than two years.  Thanks to this unified work they have been able to help their families more than they had thought possible.

Consorcia is one of the committee members.  She joined the group because she needed to have work that would generate more income in order to meet household expenses and also to pay for her children’s schooling since she’s a single mother head of household.

She buys new and used clothes to resell.  She hopes for a better future for her children which is why she strives daily to provide them with the opportunity to study and attain a better future.  She’s asking for the loan to buy clothes to resell and continue growing as a person and as a worker.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma tiene 39 años, está casada hace 20 años con el señor Ignacio de 51 años, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos,  que aun dependen de ellos.
La Sra. Irma tiene su negocio de despensa y carnicería desde hace 7 años, cuenta con muy buena clientela y es ayudada por su marido, juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante este negocio, también su hijo  trabaja y de esa forma salen adelante y ase ayudan los unos a los otros.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de azúcar, aceite, carnes, chorizo, yerba, arroz y otros artículos que le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Irma, 39, has been married to Ignacio, 51, for 20 years.  They have two children that still depend on them.  

Irma has had her grocery store and butcher shop for the last 7 years.  She has a very good clientele and gets help from her husband.  Together, they run the business.  Her son works too and they are all able to get ahead this way helping each other out.

She’s asking for this loan to buy sugar, oil, meat, chorizo, tea, rice and other items to be able to offer variety to her customers thus improving her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married, with three children. She is 38 years old and lives in San Roque, Rizal, Philippines. 

Marites owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 5,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Marites has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2011. In the future, Marites plans to save her returns for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals for raising bananas.

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old and widowed with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for four years and earns additional income from making cakes and tailoring.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kishwer's Group

texts.en:
Kishwer is married and the mother of son and a daughter.  Kishwer is a housewife, remains at home, and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and always tries to give comfort to her family with her efforts.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband.  Her husband operates a donkey cart through which he offers hauling services to his clients.  He puts loads on his donkey cart and moves them from one place to another.

With the loan investment, he will buy a new bigger cart for improvement of his business. This will help him providing better quality hauling services to his clients and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy a bigger donkey cart for her husband's hauling business.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Esperanza“ está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de mote, venta de artículos de ferretería, feriantes, venta de ropa de niños, venta de ropa, almacén, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Sandra integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en tercera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste con en polera color azul con adornos de color rosado, usa una medalla y su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de almacén, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa de lunes a domingo con un horario de 07.30 hasta las 22.30 horas.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para su almacén los compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras de confites a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará chocolates, dulces, fideos, mantequillas y harinas.
Una de las metas de Sandra en su negocio, son tener la oportunidad de agrandar su negocio, en el cual pueda atender a más clientela, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Sandra vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 22, 10, y 8 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal es terminar de construir su casa para brindarle a su familia un buen pasar y a nivel laboral tener un negocio más grande.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza” Communal Bank is comprised of nineteen entrepreneurs engaged in various trades that include selling husked wheat, hardware, children’s clothing, and general clothing as well as exhibiting goods at fairs, owning a grocery store, and other activities.  All of the members belong to the San Bernardo commune located in Santiago.
Sandra is a member of the Communal Bank.  In the photo, she is seated in the third row, second from the right, wearing a blue skirt with pink trim. She is wearing a medal and she has dark chestnut hair that she is wearing loose.
She has been engaged in grocery store sales for two years.  She says that she works in her home Monday through Sunday, from 7:30 to 10:30.  
She purchases the merchandise and supplies she needs for her grocery store from various supermarkets and candy distributors at low cost, so her business is profitable.
She will use the loan to purchase chocolates, candy, noodles, butter, and flour.
One of Sandra’s business goals is to have the opportunity to expand her store so that she can serve more customers, generate higher income, and in this way, achieve a better quality of life.
Sandra lives with her husband and three children, ages 22, 10, and 8.  Her personal dream is to complete construction of her home and provide her family with better living conditions.  Her work goal is to have a larger business.  
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza had given her as this has enabled her to invest in her business.  In addition, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank because they share various activities and interests.  In regard to the training provided at the meetings, she has learned to manage her business better.
The city of San Bernardo is located 18 km directly south of the main square of Santiago, Chile’s capital. Santiago is known as the capital of folklore because each year in January, they hold the “International Folklore Festival, an event in which the country’s ethnic groups gather together with musical groups from all over South America.  They also host the “Traditional Crafts Fair” in which all the artisans from Chile and other nearby countries participate.  Then in April, they host the “Abril Cuecas Mil” (Thousand Dances of April) which consists of Cueca (Chilean traditional dance) dancing throughout the commune.

loans.use: to purchase chocolates, candy, noodles, butter, and flour.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El Señor Edwin, es soltero y no tiene hijos,  el se vino de La Paz hace como unos 11 años con su familia,  hoy en dia en cuenta con un SNACK que es uno de los mas concurridos en la localidad.
El destino del presente credito será la compra de sillas y mesas y una heladera para  su SNACK y así poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a la gente del lugar y por defecto mejorar sus ingresos  su calidad de vida de el y sus hermanos.
EL Sr. Edwin cometa que con al credito anterior cumplio con las espectativas deseadas le fue muy bien por eso se animo para poder seguir creciendo, y da muchas gracias a Kiva por la oportunidad que le brindan para poder superarse dia a dia.
texts.en:
Edwin is single and does not have children. He came from La Paz 11 years ago with his family. He now has a snack bar which is one of busiest in his neighborhood.

The current loan will be used to buy chairs, tables and a refrigerator for his snack bar and as such be able to offer better service to the customers of his locale. This allows him to improve his income, his own quality of life and that of his siblings. 

Edwin comments that with the previous loan he achieved the desired expectations. It went very well for him and is encouraged to be able to continue growing. He gives many thanks to Kiva for the opportunity provided to him to overcome everyday challenges.

loans.use: to buy chairs for his snack bar

loans.name: Mario Del Carmen

texts.es: Mario, ha sido uno de los mejores clientes de nuestra institución goza de un buen record crediticio poco a poco ha ido surgiendo como agricultor ha sido beneficiado con créditos Kiva el cual le ha permitido tener buenas referencias de crédito además de darle la oportunidad de salir adelante con sus siembras en las afueras de Estelí. Se acerca la época de un nuevo ciclo de siembra de hortalizas es por ellos que el esta solicitando un segundo crédito para sembrar 1 manzana de repollo. Pues el con el crédito podrá comprar insumos de siembra y pagar mano de obra para sacar su cosecha adelanta y venderla aun buen precio. El espera comprar un área mas para sembrar ,mejorar poco a poco su humilde vivienda y darse a conocer mas como producto de hortalizas frescas y de muy buen calidad.
texts.en: Mario has been one of the best customers of our institution. He has a good credit record and little by little he has been emerging as a farmer. He has had the benefit of enjoying Kiva loans, which have allowed him to have good credit references, as well as giving him the chance to get through with his sowing in the surroundings of Estelí. The time is coming for a new vegetables plantation cycle to begin, which is why he is requesting for a second loan to plant 1.7 acres of cabbage. With the loan he will be able to buy sowing supplies and pay for labor to get the harvest through and sell it at a good price. He hopes to buy a larger plot of land to sow, improve little by little his humble housing and make his product better known as fresh vegetables of very high quality.

loans.use: to plant 1.7 acres of cabbage

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eulalia is 58 years old. One of her children is in school.

Eulalia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Eulalia requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy crude oil, salt, fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Eulalia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Eulalia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy crude oil, salt, fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Sharifakhon

texts.en:
Sharifakhon is a young and purposeful woman. She is a woman who has "golden hands."   For more than three years, she has been busy sewing dresses for women.  She sews very wonderful dresses, and that’s why she has many customers. 

Sharifakhon is not married yet and lives with her parents. Her parents love her very much. She wants to repair their house because it is in bad condition. She is asking a loan to buy building materials to repair the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is married, with five children.  He is 54 years old and lives at Deboloc, Plaridel. 

Loreto raises crops for a living.  He plants and harvests coconut for sale in the local community.   He has been in this business for three years.  Each month, he earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. He requested a loan of PHP 16,368 to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

In 2011, Loreto joined GDMPC. In the future, Loreto wants to save as a reserve for emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for raising coconut.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a Kiva borrower. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be a diligent woman. She operates a tailoring business and a grocery store where she sells clothes and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to buy a farm for increasing her stock of vegetables and fruits within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her grocery store

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her clothes-selling business.

With the loan, she will increase her stock by purchasing a variety of clothes from a wholesaler.
 
This will minimize her purchasing and traveling costs, and it will help her to attract more clients.

She is very experienced in her business and well-known in her community for her professional dealings and quality products.

She is confident that by putting money into her business, her business will improve.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes-selling business

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix, es un humilde campesino quien habita en la comarca La Sirena en las afuera de Estelí, lleva 40 años dedicándose a la agricultura, es padre y abuelo de una gran familia todos de procedencia humilde y quienes aprendieron el oficio de la agricultura. El empezó a sembrar por si solo cuando tenia 28 años de edad , este oficio lo aprendió de su padre que por tradición han sido campesinos agricultores . El siembra granos básicos y hortalizas, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado que es otra actividad que realiza para generar ingresos actividad que realiza en conjunto con su familia. El esta requiriendo el crédito para la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra de la siembra de pipianes. Esto le permitirá sembrar a el ½ manzana de frescos y verdes pipianes vegetal de mucho consumo en su zona. Además de obtener un buen rendimiento y calidad que le ayudara a vender mas rápido el producto cubrir los costos de producción y ampliar sus áreas de siembra pues desea sembrar tomates una vez que finalice la siembras de pipián.
texts.en:
Felix is a humble farmer who lives in the La Sirena district in the outskirts of Estelí. He has made a living in agriculture for 40 years. He is a father and grandfather of a large family, all of whom are from humble origins and learned the skills of agriculture. He began planting when he was only 28 years old. By tradition they have been agricultural farmers and he learned the skill from his father.

He plants staple grains and vegetables and also raises livestock which is an additional job that he does to generate income. He does this together with his family. He is in need of a loan to buy supplies and to pay day laborers to plant squash. This will allow him to plant about .87 acres of fresh, green squash which is largely consumed in the area. In addition to having a good yield and quality, it will help him to sell his product quicker to cover the production costs and expand his planting grounds. He hopes to plant tomatoes once he finishes planting the squash.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay laborers to plant squash.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is a 25-year-old man. He is married and has two sons. He sells watermelons and melons, as well as seasonal fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates, and bananas. With the help of Aqroinvest Credit Union, Mehman was able to start his own business.  He has 6 years of experience. The reason he started his business was due to his poor living conditions and small pension.  

Fruits are very popular among the Azerbaijan people and are in high demand during the year. People like to eat them fresh, and this is one of the main desserts for guests. His shop is located in the center bazaar, and people always pass his shop and buy some fresh fruits. His monthly income from this business is 90 AZN. Mehman's wife helps him to sell fruits.

Mehman wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables to increase his turnover as well as to improve the living conditions of his family. For this purpose, he has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. This will be his second loan, and Mehman has a good client history.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for his business

loans.name: Prudencio Fredy

texts.es: El señor Fredy, tiene 27 años, vive en Valle Tunari una población cercana a Ivirgarzama, curso hasta el primero intermedio, por escasos recursos de su madre no continuo estudiando, actualmente es casado hace 4 años y es padre de dos hijos a los que ayuda y apoya en su educación con esmero junto a su esposa, hace 5 años que se dedica a la agricultura de manera independiente y 6 años que conduce un vehículo y presta servicio  de transporte de pasajeros de forma particular los fines de semanas, esto para incrementar sus ingresos familiares, su pareja le ayuda a generar ingresos económicos dedicándose al área agrícola, donde anualmente cultiva yuca, arroz y café  para vender al mercado local, el cliente solicita que se le de un credito para hacer mantenimiento del cultivo de café, esto le incrementara la producción de dicho cultivo y también el ingreso económico, así le ayudara  a tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Fredy is 27 years old and lives in Valle Tunari, a town near Ivirgarzama.  He studied up to the first year of intermediate school because his mother did not have enough money for him to continue studying.  He has been married for four years and is the father of two children.  He and his wife are dedicated to helping and supporting their children with their education.  He has been working as an independent farmer for five years and for the past six years, he has been driving a vehicle and providing private passenger service on the weekends in order to increase their family income.  His wife helps him generate income by working on the farm. They cultivate yucca, rice, and coffee annually to sell at the local market.  The client is requesting the loan to continue coffee cultivation.  This will increase coffee production and income, and in this way, help him to have a better standard of living

loans.use: to improve coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys no se caso pero tiene una hija, trabaja con vacas productoras de leche desde hace 20 años cuenta con 20 vacas de las cuales ordeña o producen leche cruda solo 12 vacas y esta leche lo vende a la planta industrializadora en Cochabamba, pero ella no cuenta un tanque propio donde entrgar la leche asi que utiliza el nombre de su tia para poder vender lo vende a un precio de 3.2 Bs el litro, 
La señora Gladys trabaja desde muy temprano entregando la leche ordeñando las vacas y luego alimentandolas, pero como esta entrando la epoca de invierno  los forrajes de alfalfa ypasto se estan secando por lo que recurren a comprar cascara de soya y avena, para poder provicionarse de alimento en estas epocas frias.
texts.en:
Gladys is not married but she has one daughter. She has worked with dairy cows for the past 20 years and now has 20 cows. Of these only 12 cows produce milk and she sells this milk to the industrial plant in Cochabamba. However she does not have her own tank with which she can deliver the milk. Because of this she uses her aunt's name to sell it. She sells the milk at a price of 3.2 bolivianos per liter. 

Gladys begins work very early delivering the milk milked from the cows and then feeding them. Since winter is coming the forages of alfalfa and grass are drying. Because of this she is resorting to buying hulls of soy and oats to to be able to provide them with nourishment during the cold season.

loans.use: to buy bovine feed.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is involved in farming. Together with her husband, she runs a farm where they raise chickens, cultivate tomatoes and grow apricot, peach, and apple trees. Anahit needs some investment to cultivate the land and maintain the orchard. She wants to improve the land with medicine and fertilizer and water it properly. Anahit also needs to hire workers to help her with the land cultivation and gathering the harvest. Thus, she has applied for this loan to cover all these costs.
 
Anahit lives with her husband, son and two daughters. Stable development of the farm is important for the family to have sufficient income and meet ends.

loans.use: to pay for medicine, fertilizer, watering the land and hired workers

loans.name: Drina Alejandra

texts.es: La  Sra. Drina, de estado Civil Soltera, no tiene hijos pero cuida y apoya a su familia, especialmente a sus padres con quienes vive actualmente, mas de siete años que se dedica a vender Ropa, por ello solicita el crédito para poder incrementar su negocio y poder obtener mayores ingresos económicos, de esa manera poder ayudar a sus padres y ofrecerles un mejor estatus de vida como ella quiere, pues es la única hija que les apoya a sus padres de 6 hermanos que tiene, sus padres están muy agradecidos con ella pues desde pequeña se ocupo y trabajo para verlos al igual que ellos le hicieron estudiar y gracias a ello tiene un buen trabajo a parte de la venta de Ropa, es muy humilde y responsable en lo que hace, por ello su meta es comprarse una casa y poder formar su familia poco a poco, sin descuidar a sus padres quienes ya estan mayores.
texts.en:
Drina is single and has no children, but she looks after and supports her family, especially her parents with whom she is currently living.

She has been earning her living selling clothes for over seven years. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan - so that she can expand her business and increase her income. In this way she will be able to help her parents and offer them a better standard of living as she is the only daughter of her six siblings who supports her parents. 

Her parents are very grateful since from when she was only a little girl she has worked to help them, just as they helped her to study and she now has a good job selling clothes.

She is very humble and responsible in what she does and for this reason her goal is to buy a house and slowly form her own family, without neglecting her parents who are already quite old.

loans.use: to sell clothes.

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
Mujeres en acción se llama este grupo muy trabajador, que gracias a su arduo trabajo ya está en el ciclo numero 18. Nilda es la presidenta, y cuenta que es modista, y que trabaja en esto desde hace ya mucho tiempo, y es gracias a su trabajo que ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
La meta de Nilda es poder tener algún día, un gran taller de costura, con lo que pueda seguir trabajando y también dando trabajo a otras personas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, ya que quiere seguir trabajando y haciendo sus prendas.
texts.en:
This hardworking group is called Mujeres en acción (Women in Action).  Thanks to their great effort they are in their 18th cycle.  Nilda is the president and she is a dressmaker.  She has been in this business for a long time and thanks to her work, she has helped her family and has been able to give them a life without privations.

Nilda’s goal is to one day to have a big dressmaking workshop where she can keep working and also give jobs to others.  She is requesting a loan to buy fabric because she wants to continue working and making the clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 52-year-old woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 14 to 26 years old. She describes herself to be a kind and supportive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as sugar, flour, rice, etc. She has been involved in this business for 29 years. Her business is located along a busy highway and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the delay of payments from customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household items. Her business goal is to run a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have built a house for her family as she is the sole provider of the family.

loans.use: to buy household items to resell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is married and a mother of one dependent. She is 24 years old and lives in Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Mary Ann is a farmer. She plants and sells vegetables to earn a living. She delivers vegetables like leafy vegetables and eggplant to the local market. She has been doing this business for two years. She earns PHP 5,000 each month in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers. Mary Ann has been a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es: El cliente es Jose Miguel tiene 25 años, de la ciudad de Cochabamba - Bolivia, estudio hasta el nivel primario en una escuela fiscal, no termino el colegio por problemas económicos de sus padres, empezó a trabajar de chofer de taxi desde muy joven, vivió en alquiler por varios años debido a que no cuenta con casa propia. Conoció a la señora Neysa y ahora convive con ella hace mas de cinco años, tienen dos hijos pequeños que estudian en un colegio fiscal de la zona de Sacaba, viven en la casa de sus suegros en Sacaba-Cochabamba, colaboran con los gastos de la vivienda. Hace dos años se compro un trufi con el cual trabaja en la línea de trufi 233, trabaja de lunes a sábado, su vehículo tiene capacidad para llevar a 13 personas. Su esposa se dedica a la cría y venta de chanchos. El crédito que solicita es para la ampliación de criaderos de chanchos para así tener mayores ingresos y mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en: The client, Jose Miguel, is 25 years old and is from Cochabamba, Bolivia.  He studied up to the primary level in a public school but he didn’t finish school because his parents had financial difficulties.  He began working as a taxi driver at a very young age.  He does not have his own home and had been renting for several years.  Then he met Neysa and has been living with her for five years. They have two small children that attend the public school in the Sacaba area.  The live in his in-laws’ home in Sacaba-Cochabamba where they share the household expenses. Two years ago, he bought a trufi (15 passenger van that travels a set route) and works the 233 trufi line.  He works from Monday to Saturday and his vehicle has a thirteen passenger capacity.  His wife breeds and sells pigs.  The purpose of the loan he is requesting is to expand the pig farm so that they will have better income and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: expansion of pig farm.

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en: Aynur is a 46-year-old woman who is married with three children. She is a farmer and is raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has more than 10 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. Aynur usually sells her crops in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan families and also make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 80 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat). Raising crops is taking a lot of strength and work in the open air, which is very hard for a woman, and that why her son and husband help Aynur. She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose, she applied for 500 AZN. This will be her third loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Baher

texts.en:
Baher is 35 years old and from Nablus. He is married and they have one baby boy. He has owned a grocery store for twelve years in which he sells different kinds of food, juices, ice cream and stationary.

Baher asked Ryada for this loan in order to improve the decoration of his store, so that it will attract more customers. He will improve his sales and thus improve his income. He hopes that his financial situation will improve and he can provide his family with all their needs.

loans.use: to improve the decoration of his store

loans.name: Mahuzar

texts.en: Mahuzar is a 59-year-old married woman who is very hardworking and experienced. She breeds sheep for meat purposes and sells it to local butchers. Mahuzar has 30 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced farmer. Mahuzar usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them in three to six months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar or from her yard. Meat selling brings her 130 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) in income per month. Mutton is a very popular product in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma. Mahuzar applied for 500 AZN to purchase fodder and lambs. This will be her second loan, and she has a very positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy fodder and lambs.

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en:
Zacharia is 27 years old. He is single and has a motorcycle transport business in Nyahururu town. This being his first loan, he plans to use the amount to buy motorcycle spare part and repair his motorcycle.

With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy another motorcycle. In the future, Zacharia hopes to grow his business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair the motorcycle.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Kong is from a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She still has three dependent children to take care of, two daughters and one son, and they are all still in school. Her family’s primary income is from rice farming which she and her husband have been in for 11 years. They supplement their family’s income by planting sugarcane trees. As a local farmer, low crop yield is the main challenge for her. 

Kong has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and she completely paid back her past loans, which have helped her improve her family’s livelihood. Currently, she can earn about $9 US per day from her business. With a need to sustain and increase her family’s income, she is applying for another loan of $1,000 US in order to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to plant sugarcane trees. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business and earn more income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Thyda's Group

texts.en:
Thyda is a 39-year-old mother living in the Sa Ang District of Kandal Province. There are eight members in her family: Thyda, her husband and her six children. All of her six children, five daughters and one son, are dependent on her and still in school. 

To overcome the family’s hardships, she grows paddy rice as a main source of income. To better feed her big family, she also grows vegetables and works for others for pay, while her husband also helps to earn extra income via driving a motor-taxi. She has been with these businesses for 19 years, and now she can earn about 26,000 KHR per day. 

This loan cycle, Thyda joins VisionFund as a second-time client. She has managed her first loan successfully. The loan that she has repaid has helped her to relieve her family's burden and improve its livelihood. Now, she leads a group of two. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR, and the other member is applying for 500,000 KHR. She is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to maintain her family's livelihood better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Brisa Del Este Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre “Brisa del Este”  en honor al barrio en donde viven. El comité se encuentra en el Décimo  Ciclo con 20 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
La Sra.  Felicia  dedica a la venta de comidas de toda variedad, y cuenta que gracias a la ayuda de su grupo está saliendo adelante y se ayudan las una a las otras. Su meta es poder tener un gran establecimiento de comida y así servir a más personas las delicias que prepara.
Felicia acude a solicitar un préstamo, ya que quiere poder comprar los insumos que necesita para poder seguir haciendo sus alimentos, quiere comprar carne, pollo, condimentos, harina, huevos y demás. Ella y su grupo agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This communal bank has the name “Brisa del Este” (Easterly Breeze) in honor of the neighborhood in which the members live.  The communal bank is in its tenth cycle with 20 members.  Each member has her own business.  They are very close with and supportive of one another and responsible. 
Sra. Felicia  makes her living selling all kinds of meals.  She says that thanks to the help from her communal bank, she is getting ahead and that they all help one another.  Her goal is to be able to have a large establishment to serve more people the delights that she prepares.
Felicia came to request a loan because she wants to purchase the supplies she needs to continue making her food.  She wants to purchase meat, chicken, condiments, flour, eggs and other items.  Felicia and her communal bank give their thanks for the help they are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, condiments, flour, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Kapan town with her husband and 7-year-old son. While Anna's husband has left to go abroad to work and sustain his family, Anna runs a little shop, where she sells flowers, souvenirs and gifts. Anna has been running this business since 2008, and during this period she has gained a large number of loyal clients and expanded the business. Now Anna would like to continue growth of the shop by purchasing more varieties of flowers and gifts. To implement this goal she has applied for this loan. 
Development of the business will give an opportunity for Anna and her husband to have sufficient income, which will allow her husband not to leave to go abroad but instead stay and work with the family.

loans.use: to pay for flowers and gifts for her retail shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with three children. She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elizabeth is a farmer, and she cultivates bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years, and every month she earn 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Elizabeth became a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Noemia

texts.en:
Noemia is a 20-year-old single person. She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. 

She is taking a $1,000 loan to purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including flour, oil, soap and animals. She started to open her kiosk in 2011 with a working capital of $500.

loans.use: To buy some additional supplies including flour, oil, soap and animals.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emiliana es comerciante tiene una despensa se dedica a esto hace más de 5 años. La señora está casada, tiene una hija y su marido trabaja en una empresa como vendedor.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, y cuenta que gracias a su negocio puede ayudar a su marido en los gastos de la casa, ya que la vida está muy difícil, y si se lleva juntos los gastos es mucho mejor. Cuenta que su meta es poder tener una gran despensa y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, enlatados, carnes, panificados y demás insumos de primera necesidad que son los que más vende. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues es muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a shop owner who has a general store.  She has been making her living running the store for more than 5 years.  She is married and has one daughter.  Her husband works as a sales representative.
Emiliana is a very hardworking person.  She says that thanks to her store, she can help her husband with the household expenses.  Life is very difficult, and if they can meet their expenses together, it's much better.  Emiliana says that her goal is to have a large store to be able to continue helping her family.
Emiliana is requesting the loan to purchase beverages, canned goods, meats, baked goods and other basic food items, which is what she sells the most of.  She gives her thanks for the opportunity she has been given with the loan; it's very important for her.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, meats, baked goods and other items.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Ms. Nighat is in her second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She has been in the business of sewing gloves for the last two years. 

Due to her good work, she has lots of orders, and now she has to engage two workers for completing the orders. She gets orders from the market and then purchases raw materials, e.g., fabric, thread, sewing needles, etc. according to the requirement of the order. Then she stitches the gloves with the help of her workers and supplies the order within the agreed time. Currently she has three gloves machines. 

In order to fast-track her business growth, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer and requested a loan amount of Rs. 30,000 to expand her business further. She has a plan to buy another machine and some raw materials with this amount.  

Nighat is a married woman and has a child who is studying in school. She has a dream to expand her business at a reasonably high level and provide a better education and health facilities for her child.

loans.use: to buy a gloves sewing machine and fabric for making gloves.

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a housewife as well as a working woman. She has opened a marriage center and helps people with finding their life partner.

She also plays her role as a housewife and does her household responsibilities well. She is very active still at the age of 53.

Her husband is a vegetable seller and sells seasonal vegetables to his clients at reasonable rates.

Shakeela is a mother of four sons. All of them do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family.

She has applied for a loan for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling at a profit.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for the vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Likoni is a small town in the city of Mombasa which is found along the Coastal region of Kenya. In this town lives Nadzua, who is 26 years old, married and a mother of two children. She decided to start her own business after having her first child. 

Nadzua has been operating a café for the last three years, selling a variety of food. Her café is located along a busy street in a strategic location where there are many customers. Nadzua faces a challenge in price fluctuations which affect her business.  

Her husband is a responsible father who always wants to see his family happy. Their children are a source of happiness to their marriage. Even though her husband is working, his salary is not enough to contribute toward her business. So she is looking for a loan in the amount of KES 40,000 to purchase rice, beans, sugar, wheat flour, and a sack of charcoal.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, and charcoal.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and a mother of 4 dependent children. She is 43 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Evangeline makes and sells furniture to earn a living and has had this business for 6 years. She earns PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 from GDMPC to purchase materials for furniture making. 

Evangeline has been member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy materials to make furniture

loans.name: Mirzoaly

texts.en:
Mirzoaly is intelligent and hard-working. He has his own car and serves the local people as a taxi man. He has many clients and serves them with high quality. All his clients are happy with his work. He earns additional income from growing corn and wheat.  Mirzoaly is not married and lives with parents. His father helps him with his business. 

Mirzoaly is asking a loan to buy a new car to develop his business. He awaits your support.

loans.use: buy a car for his taxi business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Yeghvard village with her pensioner grandparents. Anna's grandparents have been involved in agriculture for many years, and now Anna helps them with the agriculture business. Their farm includes cows, chickens and colonies of bees.   Anna would like to expand the farm, for which she has applied for this loan. With the requested amount she plans to purchase a cow and more colonies of bees. 

Anna is very excited about developing their farm and hopes its current expansion will  provide a good basis for further development of agriculture.

loans.use: buy a cow and beehives

loans.name: Nop's Group

texts.en:
Nop is a 33-year-old married mother of one son living in the Mongkul Borei district of Banteay Meanchey province. To make a living, she has been farming rice for several years.  She supplements her family income by raising pig and sometimes she and her husband work for others for a fee. With her business, she manages to earn about 12,000 KHR per day to spend for her expenses.

This is the first microloan for Nop’s group with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each.  She will use her portion to buy more piglets and part of it to buy feeds for her pigs. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her pig raising business so as to raise more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy piglets and pig feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with 2 children.  She is 28 years old and resides in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Janice owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of business. 

Janice requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase liquor, sardines, etc. to sell.  Recently, Janice joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a  house and to finish the study of her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed is 50 years old and operates an artificial jewelry business. Her husband lives in another city and is by profession a painter who paints on walls and buildings.

Naheed has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business.  With the loan investment she will buy artificial jewelry making materials that will allow her to fulfill client orders on time and increase her sales and income.  She has a lot of talent, skills and creativity in her work and is confident that this KIVA loan will help her in making her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her jewelry-making business

loans.name: Nuon's Group

texts.en:
Nuon, aged 61, is married and has seven children, three of whom are still dependents. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, which they have been doing for fifteen years.  They supplement their income by buying recycled items for sale. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day. Flood is the main challenge for her as well as for other villagers in the Sangke district. 

Nuon is a fifth-cycle client while her group member is a third-cycle client with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. They had both completely repaid back the past loans.  After the loans, Nuon felt empowered and is confident to make a living with hope. She is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 400,000 KHR each.  She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy more recycled items for sale. She hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make their living better and in the future she plans to expand her current business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Sey Ngaim's Group

texts.en:
Sey Ngaim is aged 64 and married with a single child. She lives in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district.  She is a rice farmer who has been farming for thirty-three years to make a living, while her husband transports rice for a fee.  Her current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day to feed her family and she is able to save about 8,000 KHR for future needs. 

This is the first microloan for Sey Ngaim’s group with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 250,000 KHR each.  She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farming business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Jayrona

texts.en:
Jayrona is a young and purposeful girl. She ended school and wants to organize her own business. 

She is going to organize a business of sewing national dresses. She studied at the course “To Get Success” and learned some skills about business. She is very persevering and industrious. She will be a good business woman. 

Her workshop will be situated near her house. She lives with her parents and is not married yet. She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine to organize her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo y  a la venta de plátanos, vive con su padre en la misma vivienda, él está soltero, tiene cuatro años de estar produciendo en el negocio, lo aprendió al comprar un terreno donde cultivan plátano al ver este cultivo fue de su agrado y por lo mismo se esmero en aprenderlo y seguir desarrollandolo.

Solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la siembra en la finca de plátanos ya que quiere aprovechar el terreno para continuar en la producción, pagara los mozos y comprara abono para aplicarlo, esto le ayudará para que tenga una fuente de ingreso y de trabajo, ademas poder abastecer el mercado, espera no tener riesgos durante la producción y sus ganancias serían mayores ya que él terreno es propio.

La aspiración de él es crecer en el mercado teniendo la oportunidad de proveer a quienes se dedican al menudeo de la venta de plátanos y poder mejorar su condición en el trabajo y sus ingresos personales.
texts.en:
José grows and sells plantains. He lives in the same house as his father and is single. He has been in this business for four years an dlearned about it when he bought land where plantain is grown. He liked it and that he why he strived to learn about it and keep progressing. 

He is asking for a loan to plant plantains on his farm since he wants to really use the land and continue producing. He will pay workers and buy fertilizer to apply. This will help him have a source of income and work. In addition, he can stock the market. He hopes not to run any risks during production and taht his earnings will increase because the land is his own.

He aspires to growing in the market and have the opportunity to supply plantain retailers and improve his working conditions and his personal income.

loans.use: to pay workers and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 43 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Evangeline has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 46-year-old business man.  He is married to Sicily, who is a business lady.  They are blessed with three children. He has been running a stationery shop for the past 15 years, with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

Joseph is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying his previous loans successfully.  He will use this loan to buy books, pens, printing paper and plain paper to sell.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture in to dairy farming and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: buy stationery products to sell

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is married and has 1 child. She is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. Jessa is a farmer and she cultives bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years and every month she earns PHP 4,000 from this work. 

Jessa has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure.  She been a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Jessa hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en:
Latofat is a woman who likes to work very hard. She works with pleasure from early morning until late evening.  For more than 8 years she has her own business. She has been busy with animal husbandry.  She buys cattle, cares for them and sells their milk and meat. Many locals like to cook food from her milk and meat products.  

Latofat has 2 beautiful daughters and a kind husband. Her husband is pensioner and can’t help her. You are the only ones who can help her. She is asking for a loan to buy more cattle to develop her business. You will make her happy if she can get a loan by you.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Premitiva

texts.en:
Premitiva is a 60-year-old married woman with five grown up children. She lives in Bohol, Philippines with her family. She has been in a fish vending business for more than 10 years now. This fish selling venture provides her the daily income that she needs. Premitiva is a hardworking woman determined to make her business grow and prosper.

Premitiva is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for her fishing vending business. With the loan, she will be able to buy more fish to sell to the people in her community.

Premitiva dreams of expanding her business to generate more income and revenue. She plans to re-invest in her business. Any additional income will be used to finance the family's daily consumption and other bills and save some of the money for future use.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has been in the farming business for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Lucy will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to export her farm produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 44-year old married woman with 4 children living in D'ban, Calamba. In order to add income for the family, Helen entered into a rice trading business which she started 2 years ago.  She usually gets PHP 5,000 per month. 

With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Helen is able to buy more rice to sell because of the money amounting to PHP 5,000 rendered to her. She is new with GDMPC.  Helen hopes for much greater revenue in the future for her  business expansion.

loans.use: buy rice to sell

loans.name: Argam

texts.en:
Argam runs a farm, where he breeds cows and chickens, and grows different fruit trees (apple, apricot, pear, walnut, peach). Argam would like to develop cattle breeding, for which he needs sufficient funds. He has applied for this loan to purchase a cow and a calf.  
Argam lives with his wife, Susan, and son. Levon. Development of agriculture is important for him to have stable income and provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and a calf.

location.town: Artabuynk village of  Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is a 45-year-old widow with six children, four in school. She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods.The loan would enable her to purchase additional supplies for her store, including noodles, oil, biscuits, and animals like chickens and pigs. She opened her kiosk one year ago with her own capital of $50. She also has a farm to grow vegetables. She hopes with the additional income she will support her children to get a higher education.

loans.use: to buy noodles, oil, biscuits, and animals like chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco  vive en la ciudad de Tarija, el Sr. Francisco es casado y tiene en casa junto a su esposa e hijo al lado de la casa de sus suegros por lo que no paga alquiler de vivienda, es taxista y junto su esposa  tienen su negocio de elaboración y distribución de papas fritas y maní azucarado, este negocio está ubicado en el mismo domicilio y la elaboración de estos productos es de forma diaria con incremento de producción los días viernes y sábados, el Sr. Francisco nos indica que con el crédito que sacara lo usara para la compra de un vehículo por lo que ya cuenta con un capital y solo le falta un saldo que es el monto del crédito, el vehículo aparte de utilizarlo como taxi lo utiliza como medio de distribución de los productos, según la experiencia que tiene en este negocio nos indica que sus ventas se irán incrementando a medida que vayan realizando mejoras en el negocio.
texts.en: Francisco lives in the city of Tarija. Francisco is married and has a house with his wife and son next to his parents in law's house, so he doesn't pay rent. He is a taxi driver and with his wife has a business making and distributing potato chips and sugared peanuts. This business is located in his house and the products are made daily with an increase in production on Fridays and Saturdays. Francisco tells us that with the loan he will take out, he will buy a vehicle, because he already has some capital and he only lacks the balance, which is the ammount of the loan. The vehicle, in addition to being used as a taxi, will be used as a means of distribution for the products. According to the experience in the business that he has, his sales will increase as they make improvements on the business.

loans.use: to pay the balance on a car to be a taxi.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 49 years old and is married to William. She has been in a Posho mill (grinding mill) business for two years, earning KES 10,000 monthly. This is her second loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. She will use the loan to purchase five bags of dry maize to resell.

With the anticipated profits, Ruth plans to plough it back into her business. Her dream is to manage her business well so as to open a second grinding mill. She also hopes to educate her kids.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Furqatjon

texts.en: Furqatjon has a friendly and large family. He has a lovely wife and two children. His parents also live with him. Furqatjon is going to repair his house because it is in bad condition. His income from his business is small. For more than five years, he has been busy with animal husbandry. He has enough skills to develop his business. All his customers are happy with his work. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials for repairing his house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy home goods as lamps, pans, cookers etc. for sale in his new business

loans.name: Ermie

texts.en:
Ermie is a widow with two children. She is 31 years old and lives in San Roque, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Ermie owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years and earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Ermie became a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC this year. In the future, Ermie's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 28 years old. He is married to Margaret. He owns and operates a bakery besides owning a video show room. He has been in the business for the past one and a half years.

This is his first loan. He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan to purchase shaping tins for use in his bakery, a DSTV subscription for his video show, sugar and flour.

He hopes to purchase a piece of land where he can build better business premises.

loans.use: to purchase shaping tins, sugar and flour for his bakery and a DSTV subscription for his video show

loans.name: Kim Ey's Group

texts.en:
A single woman from Battambang province’s Ratanak Mondul district, Kim Ey is 25 years old and she plants corns as her single source of her income to support her living. She has been in this business for almost ten years, earning about 20,000KHR per day but she is able to save about 5,000KHR each day. 

Kim Ey’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village. Kim Ey is the fourth cycled client while the other member is the second cycled client with VisionFund. She has successfully used the past three loans to make her family’s living better and to afford sufficient food. Now requesting a loan, Kim Ey, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor and ploughing. She hopes to grow her business with good yields so as to provide a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is from Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is 42 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a retail specialty store. Alma has been engaged in her business for four years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Alma joined GDMPC. Alma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to buy products such as canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy products such as canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 39 years old, married to David and blessed with two children. She owns a retail shop and has been in business for six years, earning a monthly income of KES 2,000. This is her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD She will use the loan to purchase sugar, stationery and rice for resale. With the anticipated profits, she plans to invest it back into the business. Her dreams and hopes are that her business prospers and that she achieves her goals in life.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, stationery and rice for resale.

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Philister is 40 years of age and is from Chemundu.  She is single and blessed with three children.  She runs a retail shop and has been in operation for eleven years, earning KES 7,000 monthly. This is her first loan from KADET LTD.

Philister is borrowing KES 25,000 and will be using it to purchase rice, cooking oil and sugar for resale. She plans to plough back the profits gained into her business and to pay her children's school fees.  Her hopes and dreams are to manage her shop well so as to expand it to a wholesale business.

loans.use: buy sugar, rice and cooking fat to resell

loans.name: Farkhana's Group

texts.en:
Farkhana has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business.
With the loan investment she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete larger orders on time and increase her profits.
She is very elegant and creative in her work. Her clients like her clothes very much and give her regular orders every month.
The income she earns helps her pay the school fees of three of her four children who are enrolled in local school.
Her eldest son is 17 years old and has a job. Due to a financial crisis, he couldn’t complete his education and had to start working.
Farkhana hopes that by improving her business, she will be able to continue providing education to her remaining children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a 25-year-old married woman with a child. Her husband is a public servant. She has a kiosk in front of her home.  A $1000 loan is taken by her to purchase additional supplies for her store, including flour, oil, soap, and rice. She opened her kiosk 1 year ago with her own working capital.  Julieta  lives in a town which is about 35 km from the city and she has a garden to grow some vegetables. She wants to make her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Pouwereou Group

texts.fr: Mr Takouda est le responsable du groupement nommé POUWEREOU. Il est âgé de 45ans et est marié à une cultivatrice. Leurs enfants sont au nombre de 08 et 07 sont sur les bancs d’école. Il est cultivateur de profession et est dans cette activité il ya 10ans. C’est un domaine qu’il maitrise bien et 05 personnes lui prête main forte pour l’avancement de l’activité. Il veut augmenter sa superficie, assurer le bien – être de la famille. Notons que pour ce prêt il n’a pas sollicité de montant.  Il dirige le groupement il y a un temps et promet d’encourager les autres qui ont pris le crédit à vite solder. Les autres membres sont dans le même domaine et s’y plaisent bien. Ils cultivent du soja, du riz.
texts.en: Mr. Takouda is the leader of the Pouwereou group. He is 45 years old. His wife is a farmer. They have eight children, seven of whom are in school. He is a farmer by trade and has been doing this work for 10 years. He knows his work well. He has five people helping him out. He would like to expand his land and provide for the well-being of his family. We should note that,  this time around, he  has not requested any portion of the loan for himself. He has  been managing the group for a while and promises to encourage others who have taken out loans to repay them well. The other group members are in the same line of work and like it. They grow soja and rice.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from Looc, Plaridel, Philippines. She is 37 years old, married and has 2 children.
