To earn a living, Clara Fe owns a van that she uses in her transportation business. She has requested a loan of 50,000 for van financing. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns about 25,000. 

Clara Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Clara Fe hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: for van financing

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Lucila's Group

texts.en:
Lucila is married with five children. Lucila is 62 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Lucila is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to be used in redeeming a parcel of coconut land and for motorcycle repair. 

Lucila has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Lucila hopes to acquire more parcels of land. Lucila is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To be used in redeeming a parcel of coconut land and for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Xhejlane

texts.en:
Xhejlane is an Ashkali woman living in an Ashkali (an Albanian-speaking ethnic minority) community in Kosovo. She is married and has three children. Her community lives under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. Children wake up very early in the mornings and go to the trash containers looking for food.

Xhejlane’s family always feels cold and gets sick in winter due to the cold. They have a serious problem with their home's roof, windows and doors. Her house needs a serious renovation so the family can live a healthy and normal life.

Xhejlane has requested a loan to renovate her house and to buy new doors and windows. She hopes this loan will improve the health of her family.

Xhejlane is very grateful to KosInvest lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To renovate her house, to buy new doors and windows

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 61-year-old widow, mother of eight children, who took on the full responsibility of raising them and providing a good living. Mariam is a woman with a very good reputation, a hard worker who sacrifices her life for her family's livelihood. She opened a grocery store ten years ago to support her children. She worked hard at developing her business, and replying to her customers needs.

Mariam applied for a loan from KIva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business stock with new requested merchandise such as cleaning detergents, sweets and canned goods.

Mariam wishes to change her shop's decoration in the future or to move to a more spacious one.

loans.use: to increase her business stock with new requested merchandise

loans.name: Apple Jean

texts.en:
Apple Jean is married with two children. She is 27 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Apple Jean sells dresses to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 6,500 to purchase more styles of dresses for her clothing business.

Apple Jean is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Apple Jean hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more styles of dresses for her clothing business

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 43 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like snack foods, canned goods and other grocery items.

Bella has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Bella aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like snack foods, canned goods and other grocery items.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 45-year-old married woman with two grown-up children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the basket weaving business for more than ten years now. Basket weaving is one of the booming business in the Philippines. Flora is a hardworking woman willing to take every opportunity to learn and earn. 

As of this time, Flora lacks funds for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 3000 PHP to buy additional materials for basket weaving such as bamboo sticks, nylon, rope, etc. Flora believes that if she is provided with financial support through this loan, she can finally make her dreams of improving her business come true.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for basket weaving such as bamboo sticks, nylon, rope, etc.

loans.name: Evarlyne

texts.en: Evarlyne is a 28-year-old woman. She has two children. She describes herself as a trustworthy woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, black beans, etc. Her business is located in a lucrative business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of cereals. She will use this 60,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more cereals for resell. Her business goal is to be a cereal distributor within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with the profit generated.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 31-year-old man. He is married with no children yet. Though he is employed, he gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. Mohammad has also been working in agriculture, planting olives and almond trees and selling the crop. That has been a profitable project, but it also needs more support from time to time. Mohammad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new water tank and solar panels for his house. This will offer Mohammad and his family clean, healthy water and create better living conditions for them. Mohammad is photographed next to the water tank and solar panels.

loans.use: to purchase a new water tank and solar panels for his house

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y cuenta con un hijo dependiente. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y a su hijo en una comunidad que conforma la parte rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la zona no cuenta con servicios básicos.

Anteriormente había solicitado un crédito a través de Kiva que le sirvió para contratar a un grupo de trabajadores que le ayudarán a realizar labores de limpieza y mantenimiento de su cultivo de Limón. Gracias a ese crédito pudo lograr su objetivo y obtuvo provecho de su cultivo.

Actualmente mantiene instalado su cultivo de limón y también ha instalado adicionalmente el cultivo de mango. Continúa criando ovejas y con estas actividades mantiene siempre la economía de su familia. su esposa también mantiene su negocio de crianza y venta de aves de corral, por lo que juntos siempre se encuentran trabajando arduamente para salir adelante.

El se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes para brindarle mantenimiento a sus cultivos, adicionalmente desea adquirir alimentos para el engorde de sus animales. Estas acciones permitirán que su producción de limón mejore por la fertilización y abono que se le aplicaran, dándole para la venta de un mejor producto. 

Hernán agradece la ayuda brindada en su anterior préstamo y agradece de antemano la ayuda brindada en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Hernan is 56 years old. He is married and has one dependent child. He lives in his own house together with his wife and child in a community located in the rural part of the agricultural district of Tambogrande. The area does not have basic utility services. 

Previously, he requested a loan through Kiva which allowed him to pay a group of workers to help him clear and maintain his grove of lime trees. Thanks to this loan, he was able to achieve his goal and take good advantage of his crop. 

Currently, he is still maintaining his lime grove, and he has also set up a grove of mango trees. He also continues to raise sheep, and with these activities, he is consistently able to cover his family's economic needs. His wife also runs a business raising and selling domestic birds, and thus together they are always working hard to get ahead. 

Hernan is now requesting a loan of 1200 Peruvian new soles which he plans to use to buy fertilizers to maintain his crops. He would also like to buy feed to fatten up his animals. These steps will allow him to improve his lime production thanks to the fertilizer and compost he will apply to the trees, resulting in a better product to sell. 

Hernán is grateful for the help provided to him through his previous loan, and he is thankful in advance for the help provided on this occasion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain his crops, and also to buy some feed to fatten up his animals.

loans.name: Ma. Merceditha

texts.en:
Ma. Merceditha is 46 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Merceditha is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her sugarcane.

Ma. Merceditha has been farming sugarcane for 30 years and also earns additional income from 'nipa' making (weaving panels used in houses) and a tricycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her sugarcane.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, divorced and a resident of Likoni, is thinking how she can cater for the needs of her son who is in school. She has two children. Her first-born son reached class eight and could not continue with his studies due to lack of school fees. He decided to look for some jobs to assist his mother. 

After being given some little capital by her brother, Josephine decided to start a meat goat business. Thank God, it has been a profitable project. She has also been able to start a charcoal selling business to supplement her income. Her dream is to see her son, who is currently in school, receive quality education and become a professional. Josephine is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy goats and sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to buy goats and sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sandra Beatriz

texts.es: Sandra, trabaja en una maquiladora desde hace 18 años y recientemente su hijo mayor empezó a laborar en una maquiladora además de que estudia en la universidad. También tiene una niña que esta en la primaria. Sandra además de su trabajo en la maquiladora vende artículos de belleza por catalogo y artículos para arreglo personal. Desea mas adelante tener un negocio propio e instalarlo en su domicilio. Le preocupa que ya estén muy cercanas las fechas de inscripciones y ella ha tenido muchos gastos y ahora que su hija tiene que volver a inscribirse se va a ver en una situación de muy apretada en gastos escolares y quiere equilibrar esa carga con un poco de apoyo de todos nosotros.
texts.en: Sandra has worked in a maquiladora for 18 years. Recently, her oldest child started working in a maquiladora and studying at university. Sandra also has a daughter who is in elementary school. On top of her work at the maquiladora, Sandra sells beauty products and personal care products through a catalogue. In the future she wants to have her own business based in her home. She is worried because enrollment dates are fast approaching and she has had many costs. Now that her daughter needs to enroll again, things are going to be very tight with all the school costs. She wants to shoulder this burden with a little help from all of us.

loans.use: to pay a registration fee and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Jilani

texts.en:
Along a busy street in the town of Likoni, Jilani designs and makes shoes for sale. He has an experience of five years, selling his finished products in a small store. Jilani is married and a father of two children who are currently attending school. He is working extra hard to ensure that his dream of opening a retail shop comes true. 

Jilani says that this is his sole business and only source of livelihood. He says that he decided to join Yehu so as to access loans to boost his business. He is very hard-working and usually starts his work early in the morning and closes late in the evening. With this requested loan, he intends to purchase leather and beads to make more shoes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase leather and beads to make more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz is a very clever and smart girl. She graduated from school with good marks. Now, she is going to enter the Economic University. At school she was one of the best pupils. She took part in all competitions very successfully. She has a dream to be one of the best economists but her parents have not enough income to pay for her study at the university. That’s why you are the only one who can help her. She is asking for a loan to pay for study at the university. She awaits your support. Please, help Dilafruz to realize her dream.

loans.use: To pay for studies at the university

loans.name: Novaryyas' Group

texts.en:
Novaryyas, age 33, is a resident of a rural village located in the Dambae district of Kompong Cham Province. She is married and a mother of one child. 

To make a living, she has been running a small stall for 10 year to sell cookies, ice, and breads as her main source of income. To generate additional income, she also grows cassava and plants rubber tree seedlings. The current businesses earn her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Now she leads a group of two; this is the second cycle for Novaryyas as well as her other group member. The first loan, which she has repaid, has helped her to grow her cassava in a timely way and improve her livelihood. Therefore, she is confident in applying for a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR to plant more rubber tree seedlings to earn more income. She hopes that she will maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To plant more rubber tree seedlings.

loans.name: Chork

texts.en:
Chork is aged 43 and a widowed mother. She lives in a rural village of Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has three children, two daughters and one son, one of whom is still dependent on her and in school. To support her family as a single mother, she has been struggling to generate income growing paddy rice and planting cucumbers. She has been in this business for twenty-five years. 

Chork has been with VisionFund for one cycle. After the first loan that she has repaid completely, she feels confident that she can improve her living conditions gradually. Now she is requesting a second loan of USD 1,000 to buy fertilizers for her rice field. Moreover, she is going to use a portion of it to buy cucumber seed and to build a trellis. She expects to earn more income, so she can keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for farmland, cucumber seeds, and to build a cucumber trellis

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a 47-year-old married woman with four children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in basket weaving for more than a year now. This basket weaving business is a lucrative venture in their place. Right now, Nila needs financial support in order to improve the flow of her business, its sales and profit.

Nila is asking for a loan worth 4000 PHP to buy additional materials for basket weaving such as bamboo, nylon and ropes. She said that if she is provided  financial support through this loan, she can produce more items to sell in the market. 

Nila hopes to improve her business so that it will generate more income to sustain the needs of the family and for the schooling of her children. Any additional income will be used for reinvestment in the same business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for basket weaving such as bamboo, nylon and ropes

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Seng is a 43-year-old married mother of three children, one daughter and two sons, all of whom are still dependent on her. 

The family’s main source of income is from rice farming on the three-hectare farmland. She has been in this business for 13 years and she is able to earn about 14,000 KHR per day to meet family’s needs. Lacking of water supply is still the main challenge for her family's business.

Seng’s group consists of two female members and this is her group's first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income from the farm and live a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Rany's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Rany is 51 years old and single. She has earned a living through farming rice for four years. She is able to earn approximately KHR 53,300 per day from her current business and she can manage to save about KHR 8,000 each day. 

Rany’s group consists of two members who live in the same village who are applying for the first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group are requesting a loan of KHR 100,000 each. Rany will use her portion to buy fertilizers and to spend for plowing her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn a good living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to spend for plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Tongchhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a remote area located in the Me Mot district of Kompong Cham province where cassava planting is a common way to earn a living, Tongchhoeurn is aged 60 years old and married. He has eight children, seven (three daughters and four sons) of whom are dependent on him. Some are in school and some work at the family business.  To support his family, he has been growing cassava on one hectare of farmland; it is the only business that he has been with for five years. 

Tongchhoeurn is a group leader who is new to VisionFund, while his co-member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now, he is seeking 500,000 KHR to pay for weeding and to buy insecticide for protecting his farm. He hopes to make more income so as to improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for weeding and purchase insecticides for protecting his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed is a loving husband and very careful father. He has a very beautiful daughter and loves her very much. Jamshed wants to comfort his family with all the modern conveniences. 

He has had his own business for more than eight years. He has his own car and serves to local people as a taxi man. As he is very jolly and smart, he has many customers. His hobby is listening to music and that’s why his clients listen to music when they go in his car. 

He must repair his car but he has not enough money. He is asking a loan to repair the car. He awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To repair his car.

loans.name: Huber

texts.es:
Huber es un padre de familia de 42 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Cruz Blanca, una zona rural que conforma el distrito agrícola de Olmos, situado al norte de la región Lambayeque. La zona está constituída por unos setenta hogares y cuentan con todos los servicios básicos. Sus pobladores son personas humildes dedicados principalmente a la agricultura y a la ganadería.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales, específicamente chivos y vacas, cuenta con diez años de experiencia en el rubro. Huber suele adquirir los animales cuando estos aún están pequeños para engordarlos y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los lleva a ña ciudad de Chiclayo en donde los ofrece en venta.

Huber se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más animales para ampliar su negocio, ya que actualmente cuenta con abundante pasto natural en la zona donde reside. Si logra realizar su objetivo podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Huber es una persona bastante trabajadora y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar su negocio y su familia adelante. El agradece de antemano el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Huber, age 42, lives with his wife and two children in the Cruz Blanca community.  This is a rural zone, which is in the agricultural district of Olmos to the north of the Lambayeque region.  The zone is comprised of some 70 households, and they have all of the basic services.  Its inhabitants are humble people who mainly work in agriculture and with livestock.

Huber raises and sells goats and cows.  He has ten years of experience in this field.  Huber generally gets the animals when they are still small.  He fattens them, and when they have reached a good level of development, he takes them to the city of Chiclayo to sell.

Huber is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles, which he plans to use to buy animals in order to expand his business.  He currently has abundant natural pastures where he lives.  If he manages to reach his objective, he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Huber is a very hard-working person, and he always gives the best of himself in order to get his business and his family ahead.  He is thankful, in advance, for the proffered  support.

loans.use: to buy more animals to expand his business.

loans.name: Yor's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Yor is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. One son is dependent on her and still in school. For ten years, she has been in fish selling while her husband works as a motor taxi driver to earn extra income to support the family. 

Yor’s group consists of two members and she has been with VisionFund for six cycles while the other member has been for two cycles. Yor has completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her family afford sufficient food and have supported her child’s education. 

Now she is leading the group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Yor will use her portion to buy more fishes for selling. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve her family's standard of living and keep the child in school.

loans.use: To buy more fishes for selling.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Originally from the Stoeng district of Kandal province, Neang is 26 and he is a married father of one baby son who is dependent on him. 

To earn a living, he has been in rice farming for six years and supplements the family’s income by working as a construction worker for a fee. He is able to earn about USD $9.78 per day from his current business to meet his family’s needs and can manage to save about USD $4.00 each day.

This is Neang’s second loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. He has used the past loan to better support his family and business. He is applying for a loan of USD $800 with VisionFund. Neang is going to use this loan to buy a motorbike. He hopes this loan will enable him to better support his current business by spending less time commuting and also increase his family's income so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to his construction job.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en: Shahodat is a woman who doesn’t fear difficulties. Her husband went to Russia to find a job, and he can't help her.  Shahodat has 3 little children and must comfort them with all modern conveniences. She has had her own business for more than 10 years. She has been busy with animal husbandry. She cares for cattle at her house for 2 or 3 months and then sells them to the local people. She has many customers as her cattle are fat. She wants to develop her business further. She is asking for a loan to buy cattle. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for developing her business

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo tiene 62  años de edad y vive  junto a su esposa en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Illimo, parte rural del Norte del Peru. El lugar cuenta con servicios de  luz y es parte de una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 150  familias. Pablo es una de estas personas que han vivido en el campo por mucho tiempo y saben hacer de todo. Por esto, aprovecha su gran destreza para aportar en distintas labores y asi servirle a la comunidad y a su familia. Entre las actividades que desarrolla Pablo se encuentran la crianza/venta de animales, venta de verduras en el mercado de Mochumi y tambien se dedica a la Apicultura. Cuenta con gran experiencia en el  negocio y en sus rubros. Precisamente solicta un credito de 2000 soles a kiva y edpyme alternativa. El utilizara su prestamo para la compra de animales,alimento para estos mismos y para incrementar su inventario en lo que es las verduras. Su inversion tiene buenas perpectivas ya que hay bastante demanda de animales por la zona, ademas su conyuge tambine percibe ingresos ya que ofrece el servicio de costura.
texts.en:
Pablo, age 62, lives with his wife in his own house.  He lives in the Illimo zone, which is a rural part of northen Peru.  The place has electrical service, and it is part of a small community of approximately 150 families.

Pablo is one of these people who has lived in the field for a long time, and he knows how to do everything.  Therefore, he takes advantage of his great skill in order to contribute different jobs to serve his community and his family.  

Among Pablo’s business activities are raising and selling animals, selling vegetables at the Mochumi market, and farming.  He has a lot of experience in the business and in these fields.  

He is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Kiva and Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use his loan to buy animals and feed and to increase his vegetable inventory.  This investment has good prospects because there is a good demand for animals in the zone.  His wife also get income by sewing.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed and to increase his vegetable inventory.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is 50 years old and a married mother of five children, one daughter of whom is dependent on her and still in school. 

She has struggled to feed her children by selling fishes in the local area. Phal has been in this business for 15 years and she is able to earn approximately KHR 388,900 per day from her current business.  

Phal is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Her group consists of three members who live in the same village in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district of Cambodia. She has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for six cycles. For the other members, this is the first and the sixth cycle.

She will use her portion to buy more fishes for selling. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family's income in order to improve her lifestyle and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: To buy more fishes for selling.

loans.name: Seray

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Seray.  She is married and has three children, age 9, 7, and 4, all schooling. She has one additional dependent, who is staying with her for schooling.  

In 2004, Seray established her cosmetics business to enable her to adequately support her kids, and she learned it through apprenticeship. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 260,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Seray has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy olive oil, lotion, hair products, cleansers and roll-ons. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 260,000. 

In the future, Seray plans to start traveling to Dubai, to erect a house and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Bakhshi

texts.en:
Bakhshi is a retailer from Yerevan. Bakhshi lives with his wife, who is a librarian, and two sons.

He runs a little grocery store, where he trades in food. Due to his friendly attitude and high-quality service, Bakhshi has gained many loyal clients during one year of running the shop. 

Now Bakhshi wants to increase the variety of products he sells to meet his clients' demand. Bakhshi has applied for this loan to purchase food for his shop. Development of the business is important for Bakhshi to gather more income and ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for food to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Francis. He is married and has four children, age 16, 12, 9 and 6. He has two additional dependents, his wife and a nephew who is staying with him for schooling.  

In 2002, Francis established his Junks shoes business. He began his business because he wanted to adequately take care of himself and his children after the death of his father. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 920,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Francis requires a loan in order to buy Junks shoes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 350,000. 

In the future, Francis plans to rent a shop and avoid table sales, to travel abroad and to give his children quality educations. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy Junks shoes

loans.name: Vannoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Vannoeurn is a 50-year-old widowed mother of six children, five (one daughter and four sons) of whom are still in her burden. Some run their own employment to make a living. Vannoeurn has been in rice farming on 0.5 hectare of farmland for 25 years. She can earn approximately 24,000 KHR per day. The main challenge for her is lack of water supply for the rice business.
 
Vannoeurn’s group consists of five members who live in the same village of Takeo province's Bati district of Cambodia and this is her first group loan with VisionFund. She and her group are applying for a loan of 800,000 KHR each. As the leader, Vannoeurn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for plowing. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo de diecisiete años en el distrito de Zaña, una zona conocida por mantener tradiciones y costumbres que datan desde la època virreinal del país, específicamente costumbres de las personas de origen africano que eran tratados como esclavos en aquella epoca. Actualmente mantienen un número importante de pobladores de origen afroperuano y las costumbres que mantienen están asociadas a las danzas, música, entre otras.

Zaña actualmente es una zona agrícola y comercial situada al suroeste de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Sus pobladores son gente tranquila y trabajadora, al igual que Amalia que se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales en su domicilio. Ella cría animales menores y aves de corral y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que continuamente visitan el distrito.

Amalia utiliza los fondos que obtiene de estas actividades para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Por ahora desea ampliar su negocio con las compra de más animales como patos, pavos, gallinas y cuyes con cuya venta podrá aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Amalia agradece de antemano la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Amalia, age 40, lives with her husband and her 17 year old son in the Zaña district.  The area is known for maintaining the traditions and customs that date from the colonial time in the country.  These are customs from African people who were treated as slaves during this time.  They currently have a substantial number of African-Peruvian inhabitants.  The customs they maintain are associated with dance and music, among others.

Zaña is now a farming and commercial zone, which is situated to the southeast of the city of Chiclayo.  Its inhabitants are peaceful and hard-working people, like Amalia.  She raises and sells animals at her home.  She raises small animals and poultry.  When they reach a good level of development she sells them to the businessmen who continually visit the district.

Amalia uses the funds she gets from these business activities to help her husband support her family.  She now wishes to expand her business by purchasing more animals like ducks, turkeys, chickens, and guinea pigs.  With their sale she will be able to increase her income and improve her quality of life.  In order to achieve her objective she has requested a loan for 800 soles.

Amalia is grateful ahead of time for the proffered support.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more animals like ducks, turkeys, chickens, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old. She is married to David and together they have one child. She is in the scrap metal business. She has been in the business for the past 9 years.

This is her first term loan with KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase a stock of scrap metals for resale.

She hopes to own her own lorry that will aid her in transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of scrap metals for resale.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
From a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Steong district of Cambodia, Khem is 54 years old and married with six children, four of whom work at a garment factory. Khem is a rice farmer who has been farming rice for 15 years to make a living. The current business earns her about 8 USD to feed her family and she is able to save about 3 USD each day for future needs.

This is the first loan for Khem with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD. She will use this loan to buy a plot of farmland for her family's business in order to extend her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income from her primary business to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Mwanajaa

texts.en: Mwanajaa is a woman of integrity and dedicated to her work. She continues selling blocks for construction. Her husband is also a dedicated businessman who is responsible and makes sure that his family’s living standards have improved. Theft of her blocks is her major challenge. Despite these adversaries, Mwanajaa is determined to own a rental house in the future. She is taking out another loan to purchase blocks for sale and pay laborers. She hopes her income shall increase so as to meet her family's needs. Her previous loan helped her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase blocks for sale and pay laborers.

loans.name: Hayrik

texts.en: Hayrik is 31 years old. He lives in Artashat town with his parents. The family runs a farm, where they cultivate tomatoes and grow apricot and peach trees. Hayrik would like to develop agriculture by starting pig-breeding. He has applied for this loan to purchase 22 young pigs. Hayrik is very excited about getting involved in a new field of agriculture, which will allow him to increase his income and continue expansion of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for young pigs

loans.name: Milagros Del Rosario

texts.es: Milagros del Rosario tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil casado y habita en casa propia conjuntamente con su esposo e hijos a su cargo. Cuenta con buenas referencias  y ha demosntrado ser muy responsable en sus prestamos anteriores pagando siempre puntualmente. Vive en una comunidad que cuenta con mas de 5 mil pobladores y vive en casa rustica. Milagros se dedica a la venta de carne de res, chancho  desde hace mas de 3 años en el pueblo de Morropon, al Norte del Peru. El prestamo lo solicita para invertirlo en su negocio, especificamente para la compra de animales menores tales como chivos, chanchos y de esa forma tenga mas ingresos para el sustento de su familia, y por ende una mejor condicion de vida en la zona. El mercado tiene potencial para la inversion en este tipo de negocio, dado que son pocas las personas que tienen este negocio y las perspectivas del mercado son buenas para la inversion en la compra de animales, pues le darà mas utilidades en un corto plazo. Uno de sus objetivos primordiales es captar mas clientes y que la venta  sea al 100%, por lo que para lograr todo esto, se esfuerza con mucha responsabilidad y trabaja  desde muy temprano.
texts.en:
Milagros del Rosario is 34 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and children. She has good references and has demonstrated herself to be very responsible with her previous loans, always paying on time. She lives in a community that has 5 thousand people and she lives in a rustic house. Milagros has worked selling beef and pork for the past 3 years in the village of Morropon, in the north of Peru. 

The loan that she is asking for will be invested in her business, specifically for the purchase of small animals like goats and pigs, this way she will have greater income to support her family and as a result better living conditions. The market has potential for investment in this type of business, given that there are few people with similar businesses and market prospects are good for investment in the purchase of animals. She expects to be profitable in the short term. One of her primary objectives is to gain more clients and to sell 100% of her products, and to achieve this she works very hard and responsibly, waking up very early every morning to get to work.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as goats and pigs

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es:
el sñr: cipriano se encuentra casado y con un hijos cursando la secundaria 
siendo asi que las inscripciones ya se están realizando
cipriano,decea poder pagar los gastos de colegiatura de su hijo
ya que hoy en día se nececira demaciado la educacion superir para poder acomodarce en buen empleo
lo cual cipriano decea poderle brindar  una buena educacion a su hijo
preparandolo para el día de mañana,no tenga dificultad para obtener un buen empleo.
texts.en: Cipriano is married and has children in high school. As school registration is currently taking place, Cipriano would like to be able to pay the tuition expenses for his son. Seeing that nowadays higher education is extremely important in order to be prepared for good employment opportunities, Cipriano would like to be able to provide his son with a good education. This way, he will prepare him well for the future and he will not have trouble finding a good job.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has four children aged 10, 8, 5 and 4. 

In 2001, Mohamed established his jewelry business. He began his business just to have himself engaged in an income-generating activity, and that is his only source of survival. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 670,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy ladies bags, wallets, necklaces for gentlemen and bracelets. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 230,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to seek more funds and improve his stock level, to start running to Dubai for cheaper prices and to build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy jewelry.

loans.name: Sheride

texts.en:
Sheride lives in a small village of Kosovo with her husband and five children: two boys and three girls. Sheride is a hardworking woman who works a lot to earn a living.

Sheride runs an agricultural business with her boys. They use the tractor to provide seasonal agricultural services to local farmers and charge a service fee for the work. This will significantly increase the family's income, and the increased income will enable Sheride to reinvest in the family's agricultural land to expand it and make it more profitable. With these activities, the family's living conditions will improve.

With the increased income, they will be able to expand their agricultural business. 

Sheride requested a loan to buy new tools for her tractor.

She wanted to thank all of the lenders at Kiva for their kindness and generous support.

loans.use: To buy new tools for her tractor.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is married with five children. Tessie is 55 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay in the Philippines. She sells dresses to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 30,000 from her business. Tessie has requested a loan of 6,500 to purchase more dress styles for her clothing business. Tessie is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Tessie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dress styles for her clothing business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with two children. Rosita is 56 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Rosita is a manicurist and pedicurist. She has had this business service for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more equipment to use for manicures and pedicures. Rosita has been a member of PMPC for three years.

In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to use for manicures and pedicures.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la comunidad en donde reside solo cuenta con energía eléctrica y esta dedicada principalmente a actividades agrícolas y ganaderas.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio en donde ofrece en venta artículos diversos como prendas de vestir, losería, utencilios de oficina, golosinas, entre otros. Adicionalmente cuenta con aves de corral las cuales engorda y vende en el mercado local.

Violeta pone especial empeño en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir, ya que las adquiere por temporadas y en base a pedidos, también recorre los caseríos aledaños ofreciéndola en venta. Por ello en esta ocasión se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más prendas de vestir para así atender pedidos de sus clientes y seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Violeta es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver progresar a sus hijos y otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella agradece de antemano la atención brindada.
texts.en:
Violeta is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children, in one of the farmhouses that forms part of the rural agricultural district of Tambogrande. The community where she lives only has electric energy, and its members are dedicated principally to agricultural and livestock activities. 

She has a small business established in her home from which she sells diverse products such as garnments, office supplies, and sweets among others. Additionally she raises poultry which she sells in the local market.

Violeta puts special effort into her garment selling business, and she acquires her garments according to the season and on the basis of order. She also goes door to door to the houses in her region offering garments for sale. As a result, she is now asking for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she will invest in buying more garnments in order to satisfy her clients' demands and continue growing her business.

Violeta is a very hardworking women and very dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to see her children progress and to provide them with a better quality of life. She is very grateful in advance for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy more garnments to better attend her clients' orders and continue growing her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 38 years old. She is married to Ngari, and together they have three children. Eunice is a tailor and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase clothing material, zippers and buttons for use in her business.

She hopes to be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man who, in 2011, opened an Internet cafe in his village to entertain his villagers with educational things rather than with useless things.
Ali is a smart man, well known in his region for his special talent and services he provides to his customers. Ali applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to renew his computers, buy an LCD TV and a pool table, to serve his customers and to attract them to new ideas.
This is his first experience with Al Majmoua, and he hopes that the future loans will help in expanding his business targets and expectations.

loans.use: to renew his computers, buy an LCD TV and a pool table.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with five children.
To earn a living, Lerma sells a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 5000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Lerma has requested a loan of 3500 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients for her business.
Lerma is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Lerma would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack business.

loans.name: Merry Lou

texts.en:
Merry Lou is 40 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with three children.
To earn a living, Merry Lou has a restaurant business. She earns about 8000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Merry Lou has requested a loan of 6500 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her restaurant.
Merry Lou is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Merry Lou would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 64 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.

To earn a living, Rosario owns a bakery. She earns about 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Rosario has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery business.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosario would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Medesse Agathe

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Medesse Agathe est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés dans une école de la place. Le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. Medesse Agathe a une personne à charge et s'est spécialisée dans la vente des sacs de riz de 5kilo, des boissons de SOBEBRA, des produits de beauté et de divers depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la sous région et dans des dépôts de la SOBEBRA. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de satisfaire les besoins des clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Fiandev en vue d'accroître son bénéfice. Le surplus dégagé lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de leurs fournir des soins médicaux adéquats.
texts.en:
Medesse Agathe, aged 37, is married and the mother of three children, of whom two are enrolled in a local school. The oldest is 10 and the youngest is one year old.  Medesse Agathe is caring for one other person. 

She has specialized in selling 5-kilogram sacks of rice, drinks made by SOBEBRA, cosmetics and various other items for several years. She buys her merchandise in a district market and at SOBEBRA drinks depots. Wishing to grow her working capital and satisfy the needs of her customers, she has requested and received a loan from Fiandev with the goal of increasing her profit. The extra income she will make will allow her to help pay school fees for her children and furnish them with adequate medical care.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of tinned goods, one carton of sugar, 12 sacks of rice, and 15 crates of drinks from  SOBEBRA

loans.name: Luciana Prudencia

texts.es: Lucila tiene 42 años de edad esta casada y con 2 hijos. Es uan persona muy sonriente y trabajadora. Vive en la parte rural Distrito de Tambogrande al Norte de Peru. Ella se dedicada a la crianza de ganado ovino y agricultura. Cuenta con 25 cabezas de ovino ademas de 100 plantas de limón en el terreno que su padre le ha dado como herencia, su esposo lo apoya en sus actividades que realiza. Ella disfruta de la vida en el campo, a pesar de tener que trabjar muy duro. Sin embargo, la familia entera se apoyan entre si para hacer sus condiciones humildes mas amenar y vivir felices. Con la intencion de mantener su manera de vida, ella ha solicitado un prestamo de 2000 soles a Edpyme alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva. El destino del crédito será la compra de alimentos para ovinos y ademas de fertilizante para su cultivo de limón, lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucila is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very happy and hardworking person. She lives in the rural district of Tambogrande in the north of Peru. She works raising sheep and in other agricultural activities. Currently, she has 25 sheep in addition to 100 lime trees on the land that she inherited from her father, and her husband supports her in the work that she does. She enjoys life in the countryside, despite having to work very hard. Nevertheless, she and her family members support each other in order to make their humble conditions more acceptable and to live happily.

In order to maintain her way of life, she is asking for a loan of 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa with the support of Kiva. She will use this loan to buy food for her sheep, as well as to buy fertilizer for her lime trees, which will permit her to continue growing her business and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food for her sheep and fertilizer to grow limes

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en: Hermine lives in Azatavan village and is married with three sons. Hermine's parents-in-law also live with her family. The main source of income for Hermine and her family is the farm, where they keep chickens, turkeys, cultivate beans and keep apricot and walnut trees. In order to increase the income from agriculture, Hermine would like to start breeding cows, too. With the loan's help she plans to purchase a cow and forage. This will allow Hermine to earn more income and ensure improved living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima, 36, is a mother of four, all of whom are in school. She is married to a businessman who provides her support to cover household expenses. Halima is an entrepreneur who loves her food-selling business which she has run for the last four years. She sells her food at the open-air market. She says her capital is insufficient to expand the business. This is why she visited the Yehu offices to ask for a loan in the amount of KSH 20,000 to boost her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and charcoal. She has had a large customer base, including some to whom she has extended credit. However, she says that some of her creditors default which becomes a challenge. She is struggling hard to ensure that she meets her family’s needs. Her focus is to open a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and charcoal.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Alfonso es originario de la ciudad de Tampico Tamaulipas y radica en esta ciudad de Nuevo Laredo desde hace varios años. El Sr. Alfonso es profesor de ingles en dos escuelas primarias de esta ciudad desde hace 6 años.  Su esposa la Sra. esmeralda también es maestra de primaria y tienen dos hijos en edad escolar.  Con sus ingresos como maestros solventan los gastos escolares y de manutención de su familia. Alfonso se quiere superar y con ello darles mejor calidad de vida a su familia es por eso que quiere entrar a un curso de ingles como una maestría, sus hijos lo apoyan y su esposa esta  encantada de saber que su esposo decide seguir adelante cada  vez mas por su propio esfuerzo.
texts.en: Alfonso is from the city of Tampico Tamaulipas and has lived in the city of Nuevo Laredo for many years. Alfonso has been an English teacher in two primary schools in this city for the past 6 years. His wife Esmeralda is also a primary school teacher, and they have two school-aged children. With their income as teachers they are able to pay for school and other family maintenance expenses. Alfonso would like to get ahead and be able to provide his family with a better quality of life, and as a result would like to take an English course for his Masters degree. His children and wife are very supportive and love that he is continually trying to get ahead by his own efforts.

loans.use: to pay for a course for his Masters degree in English

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 35 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with four children. Delia runs a general store and earns approximately 10,000 per month from her business. She has requested a loan of 6,500 to purchase more stock for her general store. Evelyn is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Minerva Araceli

texts.es:
Ella trabaja en la clínica del seguro social como jefa de enfermeras y también percibe una pensión del su ex marido, con dichos ingreso ella a logrado sacar a delante a sus hijos y poder solventar los gastos de su familia y se siente muy orgullosa de brindar un servicio a la comunidad al tratara enfermos y heridos ya que ella siempre quiso ayudar a las personas.
Al enjarrar su casa brindara una mejor apariencia a la vivienda y mayor comedida a sus hijos quienes son los principales beneficiaros del mejoramiento de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Minerva works in a social welfare clinic as the nursing coordinator, and she also receives a pension from her ex husband. With these incomes she is able to care for her children and maintain her family's expenses. She is very proud of being able to provide a service to her community by working with sick and wounded people, as she has always wanted to help people. 

By plastering her house she will improve its appearance and provide her children with a more comfortable place to live, as they are the main beneficiaries of the housing improvements she will make with this loan.

loans.use: to plaster the exterior of an upstairs room in her home

loans.name: Scholar

texts.en:
Scholar lives in the town of Likoni, along the coastal region of Kenya. She has been operating a grocery stall for some years and is now requesting another loan to invest in a tailoring and dressmaking business, which she operates from home. Her husband is also a businessman and owns a rental house that earns them income. 

Scholar describes market competition as her major challenge. She also stocks some clothes for sale. Scholar aims at opening a training institute in the future. She starts her duties around seven in the morning and goes until six in the evening. However, she says that at times she is forced to go until very late at night, especially during festive seasons when demand increases. 

Scholar is a dedicated mother who always looks for opportunities to prosper in life. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase clothing materials and clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Lyne

texts.en:
Lyne is married with 5 children. She is 36 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Lyne sells dresses to earn a living and has had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 6,500 PHP to purchase more dresses to sell/retail.

Lyne is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dresses to sell/retail.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 35-year-old married man and father of four children. He has worked in transportation for eleven years. Jihad owns a van which he uses to transport people from one town to another, but he is planning to expand his business in order to improve his income and his family's living.

Jihad applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new car to start a private taxi business.  This will improve his living a lot and will reflect positively on his social and financial situations. This is Jihad's fifth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, with a good pay back history.

loans.use: to buy a new car to expand his business

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, actualmente están en el 4to. Ciclo con 18 integrantes, es conformado por un grupo de señoras muy trabajadoras, responsables, que deseaban una calidad de vida mejor.
Lariza es parte del grupo y comenta que es modista, y trabaja todos los días haciendo todo tipo de prendas que le piden sus clientes. Cuenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que gracias a su esfuerzo del día a día está mejorando.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Caaguazú. It comprises eighteen members, who are currently in their fourth cycle. They are a group of very hard-working and responsible women, who wanted a better quality of life.

Lariza belongs to this group and says she is a dressmaker. She works every day making all sorts of clothing items, whatever her customers ask from her. She says she started out with very little, but that she is improving day by day thanks to her effort.

She is requesting the loan to purchase fabric, thread, elastic bands, buttons, and other supplies, so that she can keep working and filling her customers' orders.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, elastic bands, and other items.

loans.name: Geetta

texts.en:
Geetta is 28 years old and blessed with 4 children. He is a livestock trader and has been running this business for the past 3 years, making a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

He has borrowed his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of seven adult children. She earns a living through the sale of fish from her home, outside her residential house. Mwanamisi gets her supplies from the fishmongers, with whom she has good relationships. She tells us that she at times gets her supplies on credit.

To increase her working capital and satisfy the requests of her ever-growing customer base, Mwanamisi has applied for a loan from Yehu. The loan is intended to be used to purchase stock of fish for sale and firewood. With her profits, she will be able to provide for her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase stock of fish for sale and firewood.

loans.name: Hovsep

texts.en:
Hovsep is involved in beekeeping. He currently keeps eight colonies of bees. Hovsep would like to increase the number of bee colonies and also purchase new hives for the bees.

With the requested amount, he plans to purchase fifteen hives and ten colonies of bees. This will allow Hovsep to gather more honey, earn more income, and invest in the further development of his beekeeping business.

loans.use: to pay for hives and bee colonies.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Leonardo esta casado y necesitan que su vivienda tenga una protección de una barda por los laterales de la casa, ya que al no tenerlas le generan mucho riesgo por la inseguridad y quieren proteger su patrimonio, ellos no han tenido hijos así que ellos corren con sus propios gastos personales. Trabajan en el mismo lugar y dicen que les gusta estar juntos en todas partes pero al estar fuera de casa tanto tiempo les genera angustia al saber que pueden entrar a su casa y robar y ya no quieren sentirse asi.
texts.en: Felipe is married and he and his wife need to construct a wall to protect the sides of their home. The wall will provide them with much more security and enable them to protect their belongings. They do not have any children and are reponsible for their own personal expenses. They both work from home and say that although they like to be together in all parts of the house, being outside makes them nervous knowing that anyone can break into their house and rob it. They will construct the side wall so they no longer have to feel this way.

loans.use: to construct a side wall for his house

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a divorced woman who raises a child who attends school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.
Mejumaa is busy with her fish selling business. She has been in this business for the last five years. She is a very hardworking woman who always tries her chances whenever an opportunity arises.

Mejumaa has requested a loan to buy additional stock of fish and firewood. With this loan, the family's income will increase. With increased income, she hopes to open a kiosk in future. Taking into consideration all the above, the family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and firewood.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El Comité Rosa Mística, está en el ciclo 10  del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas son 17 señoras que realizan diversas actividades y se ayudan a salir adelante.
Claudia es miembro del grupo y comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas, con lo cual ayuda a su familia. Tiene buena variedad de prendas que ofrece a sus clientes y así tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia. Desea poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y algún día tener una gran tienda de ropa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frio y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes, dándole buena variedad.
texts.en:
The lending group Rosa Mística is in its tenth lending cycle of the women's entrepreneurship program of Fundacion Paraguaya. With this group, 17 women, all involved in different business activities, help each other to get ahead. 

Claudia is a member of the group and she tells us that she helps her family by working to sell clothes. She has a wide variety of garments that she offers to her clients, and thereby has the means to help her family. She would like to continue growing her business, and one day have a large clothing store. 

She is asking for this loan to buy winter clothing, and as the cold weather approaches she will therefore be able to serve her clients with a good variety of items.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell

loans.name: San Antonio De Itaugua Group

texts.es:
Las 10 integrantes del grupo San Antonio de Itaugua son de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que desean salir adelante y es por eso que siempre luchan.
Gloria es peluquera y cuenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio. Es gracias a su trabajo que está saliendo adelante y puede ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar shampoo, enjuagues, gel, tintes y demás insumos para seguir trabajando y creciendo como persona. Agradece a Kiva y fundación paraguaya por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the lending group San Antonio de Itaugua are from the city of Caacupé. They are very hard working and entrepreneurial women who want to get ahead and are always fighting to do so. 

Gloria works in a beauty salon and she tells us that she has been very successful as she has very good clients who always attend her salon. It is thanks to her work that she is getting ahead and able to help her family. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy shampoo, conditioner, hair gel, hair dyes and other ingredients to be able to continue working and grow as a person. She is grateful to Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, hair gel, hair dyes and more

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama” Kuña Kyrey“ están en el segundo Ciclo  con 14  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsables, están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y de esa forma ir progresando juntas.
Antonia es la presidenta del grupo y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo y de todas marcas, gracias a la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes le está yendo muy bien. Sueña con tener un gran negocio donde pueda seguir ayudando a su familia y dándoles un buen estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca la época de frío y quiere tener buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The lending group "Kuña Kyrey" is in its second cycle with 14 members. The group is known in the neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible, as the women are learning to work together and progress together. 

Antonia is the president of the group and she tells us that she works selling all types and all brands of clothing. Thanks to the variety of products that she offers to her clients this work is going very well. She dreams of having a large business where she can continue to help her family, providing them with a good quality of life. 

She is asking for this loan to buy winter clothing, as the cold season is coming and she wants to have a good variety of products to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она занимается торговлей женской и мужской одеждой в своем родном городе. Ольга арендует магазин, имеет опыт работы в 16 лет. 

Ольга обратилась к КИВА за кредитом в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар, а именно футболки, брюки, юбки для последующей реализации со своей торговой точки. Ольга не намерена останавливаться на достигнутом. Она из тех людей, которые всегда стремятся развиваться и двигаться дальше. Ольга надеется вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие и рост своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Olga is an entrepreneur from Melitopol.  She is involved in selling women's and men's clothing in her native town.  Olga leases a store and has 16 years of work experience.  She requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia from Kiva to purchase seasonal merchandise, specifically t-shirts, pants and shirts, for subsequent sale at her retail outlet.  Olga does not intend to stop at what she has achieved.  She is one of those people, who always strive to grow and move ahead.  Olga hopes to invest into a continued development and growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise, specifically t-shirts, pants and shirts, for subsequent sale at her retail outlet

loans.name: Manos Abiertas Group

texts.es:
El comite de Manos Abiertas son de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,   son 14 mujeres muy trabajadoras. Todas son mamas muy responsables que desean dar lo mejor a sus hijos y evitar que pasen por necesidades.
Salvadora vende comestibles de todo tipo, y nos dice que tiene muy buena sazón, es por ello que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre prefiere los platos que hace. Desea poder tener un gran local y así seguir deleitando a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, carne, pollo, jamón, queso, y demás insumos que desea para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Manos Abiertas is from the city of San Lorenzo. They are fourteen very hard-working women. They are all very responsible mothers who want to give their children the best and prevent them from suffering need.

Salvadora sells all sorts of food, and tells us she is a very good cook, which is why she has a very good customer base, who always prefer the dishes she prepares. She would like to have a large business where she could continue delighting her customers. She is requesting the loan to purchase vegetables, meat, chicken, cheese, and other ingredients, so that she can continue preparing her food.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 27 years old and married with three children. She sells clothes in a busy environment with reliable customers. She has been in the business since 2009.

Through Faulu Kenya, Beatrice has been able to manage her business well because she has been trained in business management. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила замужем. У нее есть пятилетний ребенок.

Людмила работает на предприятии. Также она дополнительно подрабатывает - выполняет бухгалтерский учет для частных придпренимателей. Людмила преданна своей семье и работе.

Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на  отдых на море во время отпуска. Она хочет оздоровить ребенка и сама набраться сил.
texts.en: Ludmila is married and has a five-year-old child.  She works at a company and also works part-time, providing accounting services to private entrepreneurs.  Ludmila is devoted to her family and work.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 hryvnia to vacation by a sea during her time off.  She wants to improve her child's health and rejuvenate herself.

loans.use: to improve her child's and her own health

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has a son who is 14 years old. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman. Christine operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, rice and peas. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a strategic business area, and her primary customers are local residents.

Christine describes her biggest business challenges as the occasional shortage of cereals and the high transportation cost of cereals from their source to her business premises. She will use the loan of 50,000 KES to buy more cereals to resell. Her business goal is to venture into a new hotel business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have had built a house.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en:
Olympia is 43 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children.  Olympia has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan of 6000PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Olympia has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Olympia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 49 year-old married woman. She has six children from six to 20 years of age. She describes herself to be a visionary and an aggressive woman.

Mwanasha operates a green grocery where she sells items such as kale, cabbages, bananas, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at an ideal location and her primary customers are residents within the community. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy boxes of tomatoes, potatoes, and other fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand her store and incorporate more variety of items for sale.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomatoes, potatoes, and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 39 years old.  He is married and has two children. He operates a grocery store to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years. Besides, he is also employed. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fruits, soft drinks and a freezer for his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits, soft drinks and freezer

loans.name: Angielen

texts.en:
Angielen is 21 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child.
 
Angielen has a tricycle for hire business and earns approximately 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to be used in purchasing construction material for home repair. 

Angielen has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, she hopes to expand to other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase construction material for home repair.

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en:
Cinderella is married with four children. She is 37 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Cinderella is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to be used in purchasing fertilizers and sprays. 

Cinderella has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Cinderella hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and sprays

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 28-year-old single woman who has worked selling used clothes and shoes since 2007 to make her living. Such business is highly requested in her area because of the villagers' weak purchasing power. Vivian is very smart to open such a business because she knows her customers' needs and expands her business upon their requests.

Vivian applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a special used clothes collection to increase her capital.
This is her fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower,  All of her previous loans helped a lot in improving and expanding her collection. She is working hard to manage her business more and more and to keep on responding to her customers' needs and requests, especially on special occasions and new season releases.

loans.use: to buy special used clothes collection to increase her capital

loans.name: Matzir

texts.en:
Matzir is a married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. He describes himself to be an honest man . He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located at a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent harassment from the city council. 

Matzir will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more clothes for resale. His business goal is to run a boutique  within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the profits generated to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is involved in agriculture. He runs a farm, where he breeds cows, sheep, pigs, turkeys and fish. He also grows grass on his land, which he uses as forage for the livestock. As the grass Karen gathers is not enough to feed the livestock, he plans to purchase barley, corn and hay to feed the livestock. Karen will also purchase fuel for a tractor to cultivate the grass. This is essential for Karen to keep developing his farm and have a stable income, which will help him to ensure a prosperous life for his family. Karen lives with his wife and two daughters.

loans.use: to pay for barley, corn, and hay (as fodder), and fuel

loans.name: Moita Peou Group

texts.fr: Groupe de solidarité à caractère masculin, l’Association MOITA PEOU est localisée dans la région centrale du Togo et a pour président Koumaï. Koumaï est un cultivateur de profession et est mariée à une revendeuse. Il a deux enfants scolarisés sur trois où le premier est âgé de 09 ans et le dernier de 03 mois. Koumaï est âgé de  36 ans et exerce comme activité la culture du maïs et du riz destinée à la vente. Ce dernier fait son approvisionnement dans la ville de Sokodé située à 380 Km de Lomé. Il exerce cette activité depuis les années 1987 toujours dans la région centrale et se fait aider par une personne dans l’exercice de ses fonctions. Koumaï qui le président de ce groupe ne sollicite pas du crédit à ce troisième cycle de prêt, toutefois, il souhaite avec ses revenus construire un logement. Pour l’avenir, il espère augmenter sa superficie cultivable et assurer le bien être social à toute sa famille et surtout une bonne éducation pour ses enfants. Les autres membres du groupe exercent comme activité la culture du maïs, du soja et du riz et espèrent aussi augmenter leurs superficies cultivables.
texts.en: The men’s solidarity group, the MOITA PEOU Association, is located in the central region of Togo and Koumaï is the president.  Koumaï is a farmer by profession and is married to a saleswoman.   Two of his three children attend school.  The oldest is 9 years old and the youngest is three months.  Koumaï is 36 years old and he grows rice and corn to sell.  He gets his supplies in the city of Sokodé, located 380 km from Lomé.  He has been doing this type of work since 1987, always in the same central region, and he has one person who works for him.  Koumaï, the president of the group, is not requesting a loan in this third loan cycle, but he still hopes to build a house with his income.  In the future, he hopes to increase the size of his farm and to ensure the social well being of his whole family, and especially to secure a good education for his children.   The other members of the group cultivate corn, soy and rice.  They also hope to increase the size of their farms.

loans.use: to buy tools for their work.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.fr: Adeline est une jeune femme de 28 ans célibataire, mère de quatre enfants dont l'age varie entre 6 et 14 ans, tous les 4 vont à l'école.
